Restore rdo-release element

The element was removed in I1bc667d18b7658253281f101a8326a5ad319d8d0
but is still referenced in our stable branches.  Furthermore, it
shouldn't be removed without a deprecation period anyway.

commit_message:
Implement match-set type 3PAR FC VLUN creation

Creating match-set type FC VLUN, instead of host sees type.
Passing node-slot-port details while creating a VLUN.
This patch fixes dangling lun entry left when both ISCSI and FC
attaches are made on the same compute host, after removing all
attachments. Updated version number to 3.0.8.
Updated broken unit test cases.
Adding release note.

Closes-Bug: #1577993
Change-Id: I927638584093130b0e94c9cdd8074b3617baa366
(cherry picked from commit 0912153358a686721539c48a0736a321544873a1)
Conflicts:
	cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_fc.py

commit_message:
Add spec for storing auth secrets in access map

Allow storage backends such as Ceph with an internal authentication
system to return authentication secrets to the users. The secret keys
will be generated by the back end when granting access to shares.

Change-Id: I935d0523b76bce5274728fb5c7fd00a57d5e4840

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2016-08-09 20:21:01.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/virt/powervm/tasks/vm.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/tasks/test_vm.py'], 'message': 'Added revert to delete LPAR from destination host on failed rebuild

This change adds a revert method to the Create task. Originally
there was no revert task for this method because LPAR cleanup
was handled elsewhere on a failed build. On rebuilds however,
this cleanup code was not being run because new builds and
rebuilds follow different flows. This was causing future
rebuilds to fail, because it appeared that the LPAR was already
on the destination host. The added revert method checks to
confirm that the failed build was a rebuild, and if it was,
it removes the LPAR off the destination host.

Change-Id: I56bae7e545f56d1fdf455309d11f24b61b0a9a1c
Closes-Bug: #1596797
'}]
commit_message:
Added revert to delete LPAR from destination host on failed rebuild

This change adds a revert method to the Create task. Originally
there was no revert task for this method because LPAR cleanup
was handled elsewhere on a failed build. On rebuilds however,
this cleanup code was not being run because new builds and
rebuilds follow different flows. This was causing future
rebuilds to fail, because it appeared that the LPAR was already
on the destination host. The added revert method checks to
confirm that the failed build was a rebuild, and if it was,
it removes the LPAR off the destination host.

Change-Id: I56bae7e545f56d1fdf455309d11f24b61b0a9a1c
Closes-Bug: #1596797

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 17:55:19.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/api/extensions.py'], 'message': 'Remove resource_common_manage load warning

The file resource_common_manage.py contains helper code, but the
extension loader is trying to load it. Loading fails because it is not
an extension and a warning is printed to the log. This patch causes this
file to be skipped to avoid adding noise to the logs.

Change-Id: I138793869d8372cd292b28ae44eaa193f39a8278
Closes-Bug: #1611066
'}]
commit_message:
Remove resource_common_manage load warning

The file resource_common_manage.py contains helper code, but the
extension loader is trying to load it. Loading fails because it is not
an extension and a warning is printed to the log. This patch causes this
file to be skipped to avoid adding noise to the logs.

Change-Id: I138793869d8372cd292b28ae44eaa193f39a8278
Closes-Bug: #1611066

subject: Properly set up UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for translations
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-10 12:39:16.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/common_translation_update.sh'], 'message': 'Properly set up UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for translations

For the translation scripts, UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE was not set anywhere, so
rework the logic and set it up ourselves - like run-tox.sh and other
scripts do.

Also, rename UPPER_CONSTRAINTS to UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE as that is the
proper name for these.

Change-Id: If3f2eab1ee04bd7d53b714f5abdb1a3a2f1be266
'}]
commit_message:
Properly set up UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for translations

For the translation scripts, UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE was not set anywhere, so
rework the logic and set it up ourselves - like run-tox.sh and other
scripts do.

Also, rename UPPER_CONSTRAINTS to UPPER_CONSTRAINTS_FILE as that is the
proper name for these.

Change-Id: If3f2eab1ee04bd7d53b714f5abdb1a3a2f1be266

commit_message:
Split out factory method

In order to clear up circular dependencies and clean up the connector.py
file. This is the first of many steps in a larger effort to reduce the
overall complexity of the connector.py file.

Change-Id: Ibc1384fddd70fd5802135365fd8a5f3729cb4ea4

commit_message:
New project - Almanach

Almanach stores the utilization of OpenStack resources for each tenant.
The application is able to record the usage of instances and volumes.

At the moment, the project is available on Github:
https://github.com/internap/almanach

commit_message:
release notes: mention changes in wrap_db_retry()

Just in case mention the changes done in CR #318135, so that people
are aware of those (although, we've double checked everyone passes
the argument value explicitly now and that's the only reason the
decorator actually performs any retries in downstreams).

Change-Id: I263b2078535a3f06461e8905003b484a38d05f08

subject: Add sanity check on devstack generated tempest.conf
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-10 01:16:12.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh', 'functions.sh'], 'message': "Add sanity check on devstack generated tempest.conf

There are some parts of devstack that call the service api to verify
the extension list we pass to tempest. This is fine for the out of
gate case if it makes life easier for users. But, we should not ever
trust this for gate testing. This commit adds a check on master to
ensure we always are using the default value of 'all'. On stable we
hard code a list of available extensions so this isn't a concern
there.

Change-Id: I01be3c1392fd4642bdd4633ba5624ddacb608bc5
"}]
commit_message:
Add sanity check on devstack generated tempest.conf

There are some parts of devstack that call the service api to verify
the extension list we pass to tempest. This is fine for the out of
gate case if it makes life easier for users. But, we should not ever
trust this for gate testing. This commit adds a check on master to
ensure we always are using the default value of 'all'. On stable we
hard code a list of available extensions so this isn't a concern
there.

Change-Id: I01be3c1392fd4642bdd4633ba5624ddacb608bc5

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-28 17:16:54.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/ibm/test_storwize_svc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_common.py'], 'message': 'Storwize: Quote vdisk names to handle spaces

For Storwise SSH commands that take one or more vdisk names,
this fix quotes the vdisk parameter name in the common helper
methods. Passing a name with a space in it causess an
SSHThreatInjection exception to be raised.

This patch avoids the exception
by quoting the command line parameter in the same
fashion as was used to quote the host parameter. The UT module
was also updated to strip the quotes such that the volumes oculd
be looked up by the simulator. This mimics what SSH shell would be
doing in stripping quotes.

Change-Id: I329b22ba9006b36871ceb206aadbe51502947f54
Closes-bug: #1602008
'}]
commit_message:
Storwize: Quote vdisk names to handle spaces

For Storwise SSH commands that take one or more vdisk names,
this fix quotes the vdisk parameter name in the common helper
methods. Passing a name with a space in it causess an
SSHThreatInjection exception to be raised.

This patch avoids the exception
by quoting the command line parameter in the same
fashion as was used to quote the host parameter. The UT module
was also updated to strip the quotes such that the volumes oculd
be looked up by the simulator. This mimics what SSH shell would be
doing in stripping quotes.

Change-Id: I329b22ba9006b36871ceb206aadbe51502947f54
Closes-bug: #1602008

subject: Allow creating a floating ip on an arbitrary port
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-08 14:22:36.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test_floating_ip_neutron.py', 'shade/openstackcloud.py'], 'message': 'Allow creating a floating ip on an arbitrary port

There are use cases where creating a FIP on an unbound port is a
completely legitimate thing to do. Since our floating ip process already
starts with "hey man, find me a port please" - allowing a parameter
which short-circuits that and just attaches the FIP to the given port is
not too terrible, all things considered.

Change-Id: Iee2fc2ac7b26dfa2a48b0404a035e2820befa5ba
'}]
commit_message:
Allow creating a floating ip on an arbitrary port

There are use cases where creating a FIP on an unbound port is a
completely legitimate thing to do. Since our floating ip process already
starts with "hey man, find me a port please" - allowing a parameter
which short-circuits that and just attaches the FIP to the given port is
not too terrible, all things considered.

Change-Id: Iee2fc2ac7b26dfa2a48b0404a035e2820befa5ba

When using the ldap_backend define, it will set the global
keystone configuration to use that driver too. This causes
an issue where default domain might be sql for openstack
service accounts and ldap for user accounts. The class
keystone::ldap handles setting the drivers in the global

Change-Id: I768c5130a6fc23ec0a0bc7686f76cc859b4c8022
Closes-Bug: 1563261
'}]
commit_message:
domain backend drivers set in domain config

When using the ldap_backend define, it will set the global
keystone configuration to use that driver too. This causes
an issue where default domain might be sql for openstack
service accounts and ldap for user accounts. The class
keystone::ldap handles setting the drivers in the global
keystone config file.

Change-Id: I768c5130a6fc23ec0a0bc7686f76cc859b4c8022
Closes-Bug: 1563261

subject: Pull all puppet modules from local sources
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-19 20:42:11.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/common_functions.sh'], 'message': 'Pull all puppet modules from local sources

When we moved to ovb, the code to use non-openstack puppet modules
from the mirror got left behind.  This change moves it into the
create_dib_vars_for_puppet function so it should always be applied.

Change-Id: I39416ec38374cf2f8bbf7d5766b7c4972af45183
'}]
commit_message:
Pull all puppet modules from local sources

When we moved to ovb, the code to use non-openstack puppet modules
from the mirror got left behind.  This change moves it into the
create_dib_vars_for_puppet function so it should always be applied.

Change-Id: I39416ec38374cf2f8bbf7d5766b7c4972af45183

deprecate argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults in

commit_message:
Don't use config option sqlite_db

Config option sqlite_db is deprecated in
0a1bae9859079fb21a03716be947c5f1da6db0a2, and
deprecate argument sqlite_db in method set_defaults in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/350945/, should use
config option connection instead.

Change-Id: Idd3a9692bb86adaa0db1265e0cb976ed375a6991

subject: Revert "Add --ignore=wrongdistribution parameter to reprepro"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 20:39:32.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/packaging-mirror.yaml'], 'message': 'Revert "Add --ignore=wrongdistribution parameter to reprepro"

We should not be ignoring reprepro errors in our jobs, this makes it hard to find actually errors when projects are trying to import packages into the wrong distribution.

This reverts commit d8945e066567725980c2b8a32a0d7890659d4886.

Change-Id: I115afab54098faa0cd0007dae09da2e60134853e
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Add --ignore=wrongdistribution parameter to reprepro"

We should not be ignoring reprepro errors in our jobs, this makes it hard to find actually errors when projects are trying to import packages into the wrong distribution.

This reverts commit d8945e066567725980c2b8a32a0d7890659d4886.

Change-Id: I115afab54098faa0cd0007dae09da2e60134853e

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 10:32:35.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/test_solidfire.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py'], 'message': "Fix volume retype from SolidFire

During retype from SolidFire to something else SolidFire driver
tries to delete volume with temporaty ID and fails. Once retype
finished succesfully, we've got original volume stored at SolidFire
storage.

Change-Id: I4fb23b890415fb32dd8d98c690bf8c40f3885446
Closes-Bug: #1610172
"}]
commit_message:
Fix volume retype from SolidFire

During retype from SolidFire to something else SolidFire driver
tries to delete volume with temporaty ID and fails. Once retype
finished succesfully, we've got original volume stored at SolidFire
storage.

Change-Id: I4fb23b890415fb32dd8d98c690bf8c40f3885446
Closes-Bug: #1610172

commit_message:
[DNM][WIP] This is a test commit

Don't merge it. I want to see whether this pulls the right upper
constraints. It depends on a bogus change in openstack/requirements
which will look to push oslo.context to 2.6.0, and the
trove-integration change that should do the right thing(s) in building
the images.

Change-Id: Ib68c17dadd5fc6d8fe660bc8cc81c35a0469deee
Depends-On: I06406051c849c924371f22b9fe1b03ab99e300f2

subject: Increase rh1 max-servers to 75
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 21:06:52.000000000', 'files': ['nodepool/nodepool.yaml'], 'message': "Increase rh1 max-servers to 75

The rh1 cloud was initially brought up with only 50 servers.  Now
that we've had a chance to work out some bugs and it seems to be
running stable, we can increase the available servers.  For now,
a 50% increase to 75 seems like it should be safe and still well
within our capacity.

Change-Id: I8e9bac8c48c068cbd513190dfcebaf0e297f2dba
"}]
commit_message:
Increase rh1 max-servers to 75

The rh1 cloud was initially brought up with only 50 servers.  Now
that we've had a chance to work out some bugs and it seems to be
running stable, we can increase the available servers.  For now,
a 50% increase to 75 seems like it should be safe and still well
within our capacity.

Change-Id: I8e9bac8c48c068cbd513190dfcebaf0e297f2dba

commit_message:
Add absent __init__.py to migrations/versions

Without the versions/__init__.py file versions was not identified as
a package and was not included in a distribution.

subject: Update hieradata parameters to match recent changes
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 19:54:05.000000000', 'files': ['elements/puppet-stack-config/puppet-stack-config.yaml.template'], 'message': 'Update hieradata parameters to match recent changes

This patch updates some hieradata to match some changes in recent Puppet
OpenStack modules:

- neutron::agents::ml2::ovs::enable_tunneling is now deprecated and has
  no effect.
- Nova Ironic parameters need to go in nova::ironic::common class.
- Zaqar Keytone auth_token should go in zaqar::keystone::authtoken
  class.

Change-Id: Id6b8007abdd16feef5e9887badc50698c9646f30
'}]
commit_message:
Update hieradata parameters to match recent changes

This patch updates some hieradata to match some changes in recent Puppet
OpenStack modules:

- neutron::agents::ml2::ovs::enable_tunneling is now deprecated and has
  no effect.
- Nova Ironic parameters need to go in nova::ironic::common class.
- Zaqar Keytone auth_token should go in zaqar::keystone::authtoken
  class.

Change-Id: Id6b8007abdd16feef5e9887badc50698c9646f30

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-30 06:53:06.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/huawei/test_huawei_drivers.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_driver.py'], 'message': 'Managed snapshot should return ceiling of size in Huawei driver

The function manage_existing_snapshot_get_size returns the floor of
volume snapshot size in huawei driver. But in the driver API:"When
calculating the size, round up to the next GB." This patch fixes it
by returning the ceiling of volume snapshot size.

Change-Id: I75dac77ef6d13a7a217569f5b060a198461d344f
Closes-Bug: #1591597
'}]
commit_message:
Managed snapshot should return ceiling of size in Huawei driver

The function manage_existing_snapshot_get_size returns the floor of
volume snapshot size in huawei driver. But in the driver API:"When
calculating the size, round up to the next GB." This patch fixes it
by returning the ceiling of volume snapshot size.

Change-Id: I75dac77ef6d13a7a217569f5b060a198461d344f
Closes-Bug: #1591597

commit_message:
Allow provisioning and deployment of nodes in fuel2

This patch allows to start provisioning or deployment tasks
for specified nodes within an environment using the following
commands:

 - fuel2 environment nodes deploy
 - fuel2 environment nodes provision

DocImpact

The delorean-repo element is not needed. TripleO used DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF

diskimage-builder.

Change-Id: I4c7e211c47dcfc274ccf7a7116da2ef63ef0268b

commit_message:
Remove the delorean-repo element from CentOS images

The delorean-repo element is not needed. TripleO used DIB_YUM_REPO_CONF
and RDO injects the repos into the base image prior to using
diskimage-builder.

Change-Id: I4c7e211c47dcfc274ccf7a7116da2ef63ef0268b

We are inserting notification type plugin names on monasca_notification
start up. If another instance of monasca_notification services is started
at the same time in another controller, then this will occur.

Change-Id: Id7401bbcbdc9d6942baa49e3b335a12fe4366acf
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race condition in notification type inserts

We are inserting notification type plugin names on monasca_notification
start up. If another instance of monasca_notification services is started
at the same time in another controller, then this will occur.

Change-Id: Id7401bbcbdc9d6942baa49e3b335a12fe4366acf

commit_message:
Add documentation for OSC plugin commands

This patch adds a new path under neutronclient docs
to document the newly added OSC commands. All new CLI commands
added via the openstack client plugin must now provide a user
guide to these commands under doc/source/usage/osc/v2

Change-Id: Id16d2fb0712fe6dd4a45a765bf7b65410302f5b8

commit_message:
Designate integration

added 'domain_name' parameter to Cluster Template in API
and CLI client.

NOTE: in spec we proposed to use two domains: one for internal
resolution and another for external. But we decided to use only one
domain for both sides so an instance will have one hostname in the
domain and two appropriate A records because it's more convenient.

partial-bp: designate-integration
Change-Id: Ic636d1d9d27f9f96fbfd37b7d29d8f0add44a24f

commit_message:
Designate integration

This patch implements designate integration. Added:
* 'use_designate' and 'nameservers' configs
* 'domain_name' column to Cluster and Cluster Templates and
  'dns_hostname' to Instance in DB
* get_management_ip() method for Instance for properly setup
  hostnames in cluster info and use it in ambari, cdh, mapr, spark,
  storm and vanilla plugins
* method for change /etc/resolv.conf on all cluster instances
  according to 'nameservers' config
* method for generate heat template for designate A and PTR records
* validation check for cluster template creation because now it
  contains new field - 'domain_name'
* fix unit tests appropriatly and new tests added
* updated heat_template_version to '2016-04-08' (because we use
  'str_split' method)

NOTE: in spec we proposed to use two domains: one for internal
resolution and another for external. But we decided to use only one
domain for both sides so an instance will have one hostname in the
domain and two appropriate A records because it's more convenient.

bp: designate-integration
Change-Id: I66525c0305450d8ba08840be1c95bfe79f21fff7

commit_message:
Implement Zun compute

* Implement compute manager
* Introduce zun/container folder for containers (equivalent to
  nova/virt in Nova)
* Have a docker driver in zun/container/docker
* Remove conductor since it is not needed anymore

commit_message:
Health check for Designate

Added health check for Designate: it checks that all instances of the
cluster have correct /etc/resolv.conf files.
Also added AlertsProvider class for instance accsessible and designate
health checks. This class provides remote access to an instance at one
time and provides parallel execution of health checks on instances.

partial-bp: designate-integration
co-authored-by: Vitaly Gridnev <vgridnev@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I9e036a51f3848f9342cfcb857742e6bcc9e115c8

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-10 09:53:04.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/nvram/test_swift.py', 'nova_powervm/virt/powervm/nvram/swift.py'], 'message': "Deploy of a VM occasionally fails due to invalid keystone token

Deploy of virtual machine occasionally fails due to invalid/expired
keystone token with swift and this causes the NVRAM data upload
operation to fail with ClientException error. The results object
returned to nova_powervm will have the error information appended
to it by the swiftclient. Hence, we loop through the results
object to see if there's an authentication failure, and if there

Change-Id: I2779ad6340a58f5c58971eb142ec7b0bd76e2016
Closes-Bug: #1607772
"}]
commit_message:
Deploy of a VM occasionally fails due to invalid keystone token

Deploy of virtual machine occasionally fails due to invalid/expired
keystone token with swift and this causes the NVRAM data upload
operation to fail with ClientException error. The results object
returned to nova_powervm will have the error information appended
to it by the swiftclient. Hence, we loop through the results
object to see if there's an authentication failure, and if there
is, we'll retry upload operation, this time with a valid keystone token.

Change-Id: I2779ad6340a58f5c58971eb142ec7b0bd76e2016
Closes-Bug: #1607772

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-31 06:27:13.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/l3_hamode_db.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_l3_hamode_db.py'], 'message': 'Filter HA router without HA port bindings after race conditions

Neutron server will not be able to sync ha router data after
race happened between get_ha_router_port_bindings and HA router
deleting API call. Once the ports of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding
were deleted the _process_sync_ha_data may get a None binding
port, and then the _process_sync_ha_data will fail to get the
HA interface port info due to the None port. This patch will
filter the bindings without port.

Change-Id: Ie38baf061d678fc5d768195b25241efbad74e42f
Closes-Bug: #1533457
(cherry picked from commit 179b8301edad50f999417f52b77092a496fb448e)
'}]
commit_message:
Filter HA router without HA port bindings after race conditions

Neutron server will not be able to sync ha router data after
race happened between get_ha_router_port_bindings and HA router
deleting API call. Once the ports of L3HARouterAgentPortBinding
were deleted the _process_sync_ha_data may get a None binding
port, and then the _process_sync_ha_data will fail to get the
HA interface port info due to the None port. This patch will
filter the bindings without port.

Change-Id: Ie38baf061d678fc5d768195b25241efbad74e42f
Closes-Bug: #1533457
(cherry picked from commit 179b8301edad50f999417f52b77092a496fb448e)

commit_message:

This update adds the following changes to the Datera driver

- Capabilites List
- Extended Volume-Type Support

moved to VolumeType ExtraSpecs.

DocImpact

commit_message:
L3 agent: check router namespace existence before delete

Router namespace absence may lead to infinite loop in l3 agent trying
to delete the router.
This patch adds checks before going into namespace to prevent RuntimeError
and following infinite loop.

Closes-Bug: #1606844

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 04:09:16.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I93d9447b5f26ba474d4c283a3df49cf4461c715d
NOTE: All subprojects should do this too.
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I93d9447b5f26ba474d4c283a3df49cf4461c715d
NOTE: All subprojects should do this too.

The inputs to DIB are (in practice) a combination of parameters

to pass env variables, and support (if present) setting those

Change-Id: Iad2cb67b73e0d0a05b84d045e8147349ad5006e2

commit_message:
Add support to image build yaml input to handle env vars

The inputs to DIB are (in practice) a combination of parameters
and env variables.  This allows the extra_options dict to be used
to pass env variables, and support (if present) setting those
variables in the enviornment.  This does not change the existing
support to handle ELEMENTS_PATH.  variables are set as a top
level dict variable 'environment:' in the input yaml.

Change-Id: Iad2cb67b73e0d0a05b84d045e8147349ad5006e2

commit_message:
Use devstack test-config phase

New phase 'test-config' has been introduced by [0].
'test-config' is called at the end of devstack used to configure
tempest or any other test environments.
This patch uses new phase to configure tempest if it is enabled.

Reference:
[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/311797/

Change-Id: I8a6a3aeee89c1c08bfa5e630b1cdd8f8a5fa2007

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 10068, 'name': 'Welcome, new contributor!', 'username': 'welcome-message'}, {'_account_id': 12279, 'name': 'Janie Richling', 'email': 'jrichli@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jrichli'}, {'_account_id': 12965, 'name': 'pei ran wu', 'email': 'wupeiran@cn.ibm.com', 'username': 'wupeiran'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2016-01-29 16:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['test/functional/tests.py', 'doc/source/api/large_objects.rst', 'doc/source/overview_large_objects.rst', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_dlo.py', 'swift/common/middleware/dlo.py'], 'message': 'Change POST-as-COPY to preserve the DLO manifest contents

Currently, a POST to a DLO manifest file when object_post_as_copy
is true results in the manifest file contents being replaced
by the concatenation of the DLO segments.

This patch will change the behavior so that the DLO manifest
file contents will be preserved under a POST for any configuration.

This patch adds the requirement that the x-object-manifest
must be added to a dlo manifest POST in order to preserve the
manifest-ness.

Closes-bug: #1514317
Closes-bug: #1487791

Co-Authored-By: Janie Richling <jrichli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Iadc67c756e06a9e4b47badc52de7e5ec1939a8c3
'}]
commit_message:
Change POST-as-COPY to preserve the DLO manifest contents

Currently, a POST to a DLO manifest file when object_post_as_copy
is true results in the manifest file contents being replaced
by the concatenation of the DLO segments.

This patch will change the behavior so that the DLO manifest
file contents will be preserved under a POST for any configuration.

This patch adds the requirement that the x-object-manifest
must be added to a dlo manifest POST in order to preserve the
manifest-ness.

Closes-bug: #1514317
Closes-bug: #1487791

Co-Authored-By: Janie Richling <jrichli@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: Iadc67c756e06a9e4b47badc52de7e5ec1939a8c3

revisions:
[{'number': 21, 'created': '2016-07-07 08:40:50.000000000', 'files': ['network/endpoints/endpoint_map.yaml', 'overcloud-resource-registry-puppet.yaml', 'network/endpoints/build_endpoint_map.py', 'network/endpoints/configured_endpoint_map.yaml', 'environments/enable-tls.yaml'], 'message': 'Avoid repetition in endpoint map

Currently adding services to the endpoint map is a bit tricky because
you need to add the service in three places: The endpoint map
template, the endpoint data file, and the enable TLS environment.
This is cumbersome and prone to errors.

On the other hand, the values in the endpoint_data file and the
enable-tls environment are repeated and overwrite each other. This is
problematic since they have to be in sync at all times.

This commit introduces the concept of overwriting the endpoint map.
So we can finally decouple those files. The defaults will be in the
endpoint_data file (which is used to generate the endpoint_map.yaml)
and any parameters that need to be overwritten will use the already
existing EndpointMap parameter. So this reduces the EndpointMap in
the enable-tls.yaml environment to just contain the endpoints in
which tls will be enabled.

On the other hand, this is backwards compatible to the pre-existing
enable-tls.yaml that used to contain the whole map, since these will
simply try to overwrite the previous values, which should be the
same.

Change-Id: I84f7415a536edba2796f1915fe171aeb676fc50b
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid repetition in endpoint map

Currently adding services to the endpoint map is a bit tricky because
you need to add the service in three places: The endpoint map
template, the endpoint data file, and the enable TLS environment.
This is cumbersome and prone to errors.

On the other hand, the values in the endpoint_data file and the
enable-tls environment are repeated and overwrite each other. This is
problematic since they have to be in sync at all times.

This commit introduces the concept of overwriting the endpoint map.
So we can finally decouple those files. The defaults will be in the
endpoint_data file (which is used to generate the endpoint_map.yaml)
and any parameters that need to be overwritten will use the already
existing EndpointMap parameter. So this reduces the EndpointMap in
the enable-tls.yaml environment to just contain the endpoints in
which tls will be enabled.

On the other hand, this is backwards compatible to the pre-existing
enable-tls.yaml that used to contain the whole map, since these will
simply try to overwrite the previous values, which should be the
same.

Change-Id: I84f7415a536edba2796f1915fe171aeb676fc50b

Fix idempotency of keystone_tenant description

If description is not defined for existing resource it won't try to set
it to empty string.

Closes-bug: #1593723

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-08-09 18:14:59.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/virt/test_hardware.py', 'nova/virt/hardware.py'], 'message': 'virt/hardware: Check for threads when "required"

The 'require' case "requires" the presence of hardware threads on a
host. At present, this check is done using the NUMATopology filter.
Unfortunately, this means that if this filter is disabled then
instances can be scheduled on invalid hosts. Resolve this by adding a
new check to be run when hosts are actually scheduling.

Change-Id: Ia9e4784e02ca9ce7a3d81c962b95bee100f6db42
Closes-bug: #1550269
'}]
commit_message:
virt/hardware: Check for threads when "required"

The 'require' case "requires" the presence of hardware threads on a
host. At present, this check is done using the NUMATopology filter.
Unfortunately, this means that if this filter is disabled then
instances can be scheduled on invalid hosts. Resolve this by adding a
new check to be run when hosts are actually scheduling.

Change-Id: Ia9e4784e02ca9ce7a3d81c962b95bee100f6db42
Closes-bug: #1550269

This patch follows up on the Nova work that allows Neutron to pass an

of 'br-int') is created [2].

If the port is a trunk's parent port, then bridge_name will be set to a
generated trunk bridge name for vlan-aware VMs. Otherwise, the
bridge_name field will remain empty.

Note: until Nova integrates os-vif [3] and uses a release that contains

Change-Id: Iad72d163bc406df65866f6d962abcb78596828e7
"}]
commit_message:
Set bridge_name in OVS trunk port's vif_details

This patch follows up on the Nova work that allows Neutron to pass an
OVS 'bridge_name' in a port's vif_details [1] and the os-vif work that
ensures the OVS bridge passed in as 'bridge_name' (or the config default
of 'br-int') is created [2].

If the port is a trunk's parent port, then bridge_name will be set to a
generated trunk bridge name for vlan-aware VMs. Otherwise, the
bridge_name field will remain empty.

Note: until Nova integrates os-vif [3] and uses a release that contains
the change in [2], the trunk bridge will not actually be created by
Nova/os-vif. It is expected to be integrated for the Newton release.
Until then, this Nova-equivalent patch can be used for testing
purposes [4].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/260700/
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/330818/
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/269672/
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/332474/

Partially-implements: blueprint vlan-aware-vms
Change-Id: Iad72d163bc406df65866f6d962abcb78596828e7

commit_message:
Fix arguemnt precedence issues with os-client-config

os-client-config 1.19.1 contains a critical fix for OSC 3, however
other clients have problems that prevent that version from being used
so let's bring the critical fized here so we can move forward.

commit_message:
Add support for CIFS shares in HNAS driver

Updating Manila Hitachi HNAS driver to support shares using CIFS protocol.
It accepts 'user' as access type and both rw and ro as access level.

Change-Id: I18fd5afcea6f91d870bbfc256c71a92aad014c91
Implements: blueprint hnas-driver-cifs-support

commit_message:
Fix review_fuel_client test

1. Use OPENSTACK_RELEASE for seeking of actual release
2. Use SSHClient api instead of additional helpers
3. Do not re-request admin remote between steps
4. Fix imports order
5. Use unicode literals

Change-Id: I5b58b1b6a30d8b38740b0d3d18a72e80399a6acf
Closes-bug: #1610941

subject: Allow named sbuild chroot names
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-10 12:24:40.000000000', 'files': ['build-tools/pkgos-infra-install-sbuild'], 'message': "Allow named sbuild chroot names

With this patch, it's possible to use whatever we want as name for
the sbuild chroot. For example:
pkgos-infra-install-sbuild --sbuild-chroot-name jessie-newton-backports \
    --sbuild-chroot-distro-name jessie

will produce a jessie-newton-backports schroot chroot provisionned with
the Jessie release.

Change-Id: Id03c8acbf60eb1d80be868d111848b2ced1f0cb7
"}]
commit_message:
Allow named sbuild chroot names

With this patch, it's possible to use whatever we want as name for
the sbuild chroot. For example:
pkgos-infra-install-sbuild --sbuild-chroot-name jessie-newton-backports \
    --sbuild-chroot-distro-name jessie

will produce a jessie-newton-backports schroot chroot provisionned with
the Jessie release.

Change-Id: Id03c8acbf60eb1d80be868d111848b2ced1f0cb7

(cherry picked from commit 27d8da22ed0745db340c5ba13e329ccbc143b2f9)

commit_message:
Adding a purge_config option for nova_config

Adding a purge_config option for all configs. Adding this option for
ease of management and readability. If users wish, they can use this
to ensure that only the options they are setting make it into the
configs.

Change-Id: I85907b65a182da32659e2225ba031d4ec10de0a6
(cherry picked from commit 27d8da22ed0745db340c5ba13e329ccbc143b2f9)

commit_message:
Remove on_node_reset callback from volume_manager

Receiverd calls on_node_reset on stop deployment and
cluster reset operations. In both cases we should preserve
user-defined disks configuration. So remove on_node_reset
callback which just resets disks configuration.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I9db43d0f0fa54ac4f4d626552b0553ee7a02ca69
Closes-Bug: #1423328

commit_message:
Fix deployment_tasks api, when graph_type is an empty string

Nailgun should treat and empty string, given to

/clusters/(?P<obj_id>\d+)/deployment_tasks/?graph_type=$
/clusters/(?P<obj_id>\d+)/deployment_tasks/plugins/?graph_type=$
/clusters/(?P<obj_id>\d+)/deployment_tasks/release/?graph_type=$
e.t.c.

as default graph type. So let's convert some 'false'
values to None in handlers.

Change-Id: I238764d24fc14b2a41baaca37dabb6264e7e91d8
Closes-Bug: #1576261

commit_message:
Purge old openstack admin access user if changed

If operator has changed admin user, old one will now be stored in
/etc/hiera/old_admin_user.yaml as an access hash. Then it will be
deleted after new user creation.

Change-Id: I30213c02c4a370aee9db1597cf32dd8f08ae6539
Closes-Bug: #1578348

commit_message:
Improve snapshot handling in K2

In creating snapshot, we use "Best Effort" retention policy.
In this policy snapshot may be deleted in case capacity is running
out, causing an inconsistency between K2 state and cinder DB.

In order to avoid this inconsistency, add "is_auto_deleteable=False"
to the snapshot properties, in order to avoid auto deleting
the snapshot.
Closes-Bug: #1608488
Change-Id: I70f770ce42ff56314b893a48ff7ed1a46a4ae55f

to work with Selenium. Updated selenium-standalone downloads
and utilizes this driver by default.

subject: Fix specification caching mechanism
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5558, 'name': 'Winson Chan', 'email': 'wcchan@stackstorm.com', 'username': 'winson-c-chan'}, {'_account_id': 6732, 'name': 'Lingxian Kong', 'email': 'anlin.kong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kong'}, {'_account_id': 7700, 'name': 'Nikolay Mahotkin', 'email': 'nikolay.makhotkin@gmail.com', 'username': 'nmakhotkin'}, {'_account_id': 8592, 'name': 'Anastasia Kuznetsova', 'email': 'akuznetsova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nastya-kuz'}, {'_account_id': 9029, 'name': 'Moshe Elisha', 'email': 'moshe.elisha@nokia.com', 'username': 'MosheElisha'}, {'_account_id': 9408, 'name': 'Michal Gershenzon', 'email': 'michal.gershenzon@gmail.com', 'username': 'Mgershen'}, {'_account_id': 18238, 'name': 'Hardik Parekh', 'email': 'hardik.parekh047@gmail.com', 'username': 'hparekh'}, {'_account_id': 19206, 'name': 'Dawid Deja', 'email': 'dawdej@gmail.com', 'username': 'ddeja'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-09 13:17:08.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/workbook/parser.py', 'mistral/workflow/base.py', 'mistral/engine/task_handler.py', 'mistral/engine/workflows.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/workflow/test_direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/services/workflows.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/workbook/test_spec_caching.py', 'mistral/db/v2/sqlalchemy/models.py', 'mistral/engine/action_handler.py', 'mistral/services/workbooks.py', 'mistral/engine/actions.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/workflow/test_reverse_workflow.py'], 'message': "Fix specification caching mechanism

* The problem was that cache instance was instantiated on different
  Mistral instances and invalidation didn't work properly (known
  problem for local cache implementations). The solution, first of
  all, is to cache specifications by workflow execution ids so that
  we get a consistent spec value during workflow execution lifetime.
  And secondly, if we need to build a specification based on
  workflow definition id we also need to use 'updated_at' as part of
  cache key so that if workflow definition has changed the cache is
  updated properly. Old cache entities would be kicked out of cache
  by LRU algorithm as the cache runs out of space.

Change-Id: If97b2e47d8adcbd7b5d5844b56e24eac1b1ae6c1
"}]
commit_message:
Fix specification caching mechanism

* The problem was that cache instance was instantiated on different
  Mistral instances and invalidation didn't work properly (known
  problem for local cache implementations). The solution, first of
  all, is to cache specifications by workflow execution ids so that
  we get a consistent spec value during workflow execution lifetime.
  And secondly, if we need to build a specification based on
  workflow definition id we also need to use 'updated_at' as part of
  cache key so that if workflow definition has changed the cache is
  updated properly. Old cache entities would be kicked out of cache
  by LRU algorithm as the cache runs out of space.

Change-Id: If97b2e47d8adcbd7b5d5844b56e24eac1b1ae6c1

commit_message:
Using Cinder snapshot as Trove backups

As part of Amrith's storage capabilities improvement for Trove we are
implementing the option to use Cinder snapshots as Trove backup. This
will give a option to backup her database in a faster way than what it
is done today.

APIImpact

Change-Id: Id22d390e811c12792827a5bcfc2497d53fb39809
Related-bp: blueprint snapshot-as-backup-strategy

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-09 15:05:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py'], 'message': 'rt: Remove incorrect unit test of resize revert

There was one remaining "unit" test in test_tracker.py's TestMoveClaim
class: test_revert_reserve_source(). This test wasn't a unit test -- it
was emulating interactions across both a source and destination resource
tracker, blurring the unit-tested code surface area. But more
importantly, this test had a serious flaw in it. In order to "emulate"
the resize operation on the destination host, the test was calling
instance_claim(). However, for resizes, the RT's resize_claim() is the
method that is used on the destination host. Therefore, the assertions
immediately after the use of instance_claim() on the destination
resource tracker were entirely meaningless.

There were already lots of existing unit tests in test_tracker's
TestUpdateAvailableResource that validated the resource usage accounting
on hosts that had incoming, outgoing, and same-host migrations so there
was no point keeping this non-unit unit test around.

Change-Id: I219f3de0240759c0b8b367828365c4df8bb4986d
'}]
commit_message:
rt: Remove incorrect unit test of resize revert

There was one remaining "unit" test in test_tracker.py's TestMoveClaim
class: test_revert_reserve_source(). This test wasn't a unit test -- it
was emulating interactions across both a source and destination resource
tracker, blurring the unit-tested code surface area. But more
importantly, this test had a serious flaw in it. In order to "emulate"
the resize operation on the destination host, the test was calling
instance_claim(). However, for resizes, the RT's resize_claim() is the
method that is used on the destination host. Therefore, the assertions
immediately after the use of instance_claim() on the destination
resource tracker were entirely meaningless.

There were already lots of existing unit tests in test_tracker's
TestUpdateAvailableResource that validated the resource usage accounting
on hosts that had incoming, outgoing, and same-host migrations so there
was no point keeping this non-unit unit test around.

Change-Id: I219f3de0240759c0b8b367828365c4df8bb4986d

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-08-09 15:05:33.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py'], 'message': 'rt: Refactor test_dupe_filter unit test

The TestMoveClaim.test_dupe_filter() unit test was a poorly-written unit
test. Not only was it not actually isolating the particular piece of
code being tested properly, but the assertion it was making was not
proving that filtering that the code was doing actually worked.

This patch refactors that unit test out of TestMoveClaim and into its
own TestUpdateUsageFromMigrations test case class that isolates the area
of tested code to just the function in question and puts assertions into
the unit test that actually verify the *correct* migration is filtered
not just *any* migration.

Change-Id: Icff202e0c8866cad72fe977281a5829759659282
'}]
commit_message:
rt: Refactor test_dupe_filter unit test

The TestMoveClaim.test_dupe_filter() unit test was a poorly-written unit
test. Not only was it not actually isolating the particular piece of
code being tested properly, but the assertion it was making was not
proving that filtering that the code was doing actually worked.

This patch refactors that unit test out of TestMoveClaim and into its
own TestUpdateUsageFromMigrations test case class that isolates the area
of tested code to just the function in question and puts assertions into
the unit test that actually verify the *correct* migration is filtered
not just *any* migration.

Change-Id: Icff202e0c8866cad72fe977281a5829759659282

commit_message:
rt: Remove duplicate unit test for missing mig ctx

Removes a unit test that purported to test that "a resource audit
occurred" even if an instance's migration_context attribute was missing,
as would be the case "on older computes". The unit test wasn't actually
testing this though. All the unit test was testing was essentially the
lazy-load behaviour of the nova.objects.Instance.migration_context
attribute which is already tested in nova/tests/unit/objects/instance.py
here:

https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/\
8d007b4c30ac8d32da181fab06563c5442e0f3a9\
/nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py#L1299-L1325

Change-Id: I168659fbc5cb3fc064013695210bf0b223ac02a8

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-09 15:05:34.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_tracker.py'], 'message': 'rt: Refactor resize claim abort unit test

Next unit test to pull from the TestMoveClaim class and refactor is
test_claim_abort(). For this, we simply add a few extra lines that test
the claim abort behaviour to the test_resize_claim_same_host() test
method introduced in the previous patch in this series.

Note: This patch removes two existing unit tests in
test_tracker.TestMoveClaim: test_claim_abort() and test_same_host(). The
refactored TestResizeClaim.test_resize_claim_same_host() contains all
the assertions that both of these unit tests contained.

Change-Id: Idd12fa2e5eff134f91d408a434669d62d0672672
'}]
commit_message:
rt: Refactor resize claim abort unit test

Next unit test to pull from the TestMoveClaim class and refactor is
test_claim_abort(). For this, we simply add a few extra lines that test
the claim abort behaviour to the test_resize_claim_same_host() test
method introduced in the previous patch in this series.

Note: This patch removes two existing unit tests in
test_tracker.TestMoveClaim: test_claim_abort() and test_same_host(). The
refactored TestResizeClaim.test_resize_claim_same_host() contains all
the assertions that both of these unit tests contained.

Change-Id: Idd12fa2e5eff134f91d408a434669d62d0672672

I don't care for the way the migration and resize unit tests were done
in the test_tracker.py file. It isn't clear what is being asserted in
the unit tests because of layers of nested helper functions. This patch
is the start of a series that refactors these tests to be more readable.
First up was the unit test for resize_claim on the same host.

commit_message:
rt: Refactor resize_claim unit test

I don't care for the way the migration and resize unit tests were done
in the test_tracker.py file. It isn't clear what is being asserted in
the unit tests because of layers of nested helper functions. This patch
is the start of a series that refactors these tests to be more readable.
First up was the unit test for resize_claim on the same host.

Change-Id: I370d32e1019208adacdb17ae75d87a8711e4d8c4

commit_message:
Change image names to match what the rest of the system expects

The image names in other parts of the TripleO ecosystem are
overcloud-full and ironic-python-agent. Other parts are expecting
these names. This changes the default yaml to match.

Change-Id: Ia1a3fa071c07d8a60c69f32375ac6b0aa92cff7b

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-08 13:07:19.000000000', 'files': ['undercloud_heat_plugins/immutable_resources.py'], 'message': "Prevent replacement of Port, Net and Subnet

There have been cases reported of Neutron resources being reallocated on
some stack-updates. (E.g. the ports which are used for VIP allocation
and feeding VIP info to overcloud config files.) This is quite similar
in the OS::Nova::Server replacement issue in the sense that TripleO
clouds currently cannot recover from this happening. While the triggers
of this behavior might have external causes due to manipulation with
templates or environment files (we haven't found any root cause in
TripleO code yet), in general this is an issue that we should probably
prevent if we can.

Closes-Bug: #1572609
Change-Id: I1bfd3b4c2bf23ddb96905ddc654b807955668922
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent replacement of Port, Net and Subnet

There have been cases reported of Neutron resources being reallocated on
some stack-updates. (E.g. the ports which are used for VIP allocation
and feeding VIP info to overcloud config files.) This is quite similar
in the OS::Nova::Server replacement issue in the sense that TripleO
clouds currently cannot recover from this happening. While the triggers
of this behavior might have external causes due to manipulation with
templates or environment files (we haven't found any root cause in
TripleO code yet), in general this is an issue that we should probably
prevent if we can.

Closes-Bug: #1572609
Change-Id: I1bfd3b4c2bf23ddb96905ddc654b807955668922

commit_message:
Write service manifest on the controllers

Composable service roles can now define a `manifest_entry` output which
is used within a service manifest file on the nodes where composable
services are present.

The manifest can be useful for anyting that executes on the node and
requires knowledge about what service roles were deployed, especially if
the execution happens independently of stack-update or config management
in general. E.g. reloading of services triggered by certmonger after a
certificate renewal.

See the commit message and specs of change
I1cb95c06ad7c5b64ed5a2bac5bfb137483527604 for more details about how the
service manifest file looks inside

Change-Id: Ia24fcbbc7657f34f1d1e182a8323e045d164d923
Depends-On: I1cb95c06ad7c5b64ed5a2bac5bfb137483527604

subject: Add a service manifest
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 8449, 'name': 'Marios Andreou', 'email': 'marios.andreou@gmail.com', 'username': 'marios'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 11105, 'name': 'Swapnil Kulkarni', 'email': 'coolsvap@gmail.com', 'username': 'coolsvap'}, {'_account_id': 20775, 'name': 'Carlos Camacho', 'email': 'ccamacho@redhat.com', 'username': 'ccamacho'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-23 14:14:30.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/service_manifest.pp', 'spec/unit/provider/service_manifest/flat_file_spec.rb', 'spec/classes/tripleo_service_manifest_spec.rb', 'spec/unit/type/service_manifest_spec.rb', 'lib/puppet/provider/service_manifest/flat_file.rb', 'spec/classes/tripleo_init_spec.rb', 'manifests/init.pp', 'lib/puppet/type/service_manifest.rb'], 'message': "Add a service manifest

Adds support for writing out a service manifest -- a list of locally
deployed services from the composable service roles in
tripleo-heat-templates. The only currently implemented provider is a
flat file, where each line corresponds to one service. The manifest
format also allows adding simple properties to the services, to allow
further clarification of what is deployed on the node. The format is:

SERVICE_NAME[:PROP1=VALUE1[,PROP2=VALUE2]...]

An example of possible service manifest text file:

glance-api
glance-registry
haproxy:pacemaker-managed=true
rabbitmq:pacemaker-managed=true

The lines are sorted. Properties are optional. Service names must not
contain ':' and property names and values must not contain '=' and ','
to make sure the flat file manifest is correctly readable.

Change-Id: I1cb95c06ad7c5b64ed5a2bac5bfb137483527604
"}]
commit_message:
Add a service manifest

Adds support for writing out a service manifest -- a list of locally
deployed services from the composable service roles in
tripleo-heat-templates. The only currently implemented provider is a
flat file, where each line corresponds to one service. The manifest
format also allows adding simple properties to the services, to allow
further clarification of what is deployed on the node. The format is:

SERVICE_NAME[:PROP1=VALUE1[,PROP2=VALUE2]...]

An example of possible service manifest text file:

glance-api
glance-registry
haproxy:pacemaker-managed=true
rabbitmq:pacemaker-managed=true

The lines are sorted. Properties are optional. Service names must not
contain ':' and property names and values must not contain '=' and ','
to make sure the flat file manifest is correctly readable.

Change-Id: I1cb95c06ad7c5b64ed5a2bac5bfb137483527604

commit_message:
Write a list of services on the controllers

This writes a list of services into Hiera. It can be accessed either
from Puppet or via the `hiera` command.

[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# hiera tripleo_services
["OS::TripleO::Services::Keystone",
 "OS::TripleO::Services::GlanceApi",
 "OS::TripleO::Services::GlanceRegistry",
 "OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronDhcpAgent",
 "OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronL3Agent",
 "OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronMetadataAgent",
 "OS::TripleO::Services::RabbitMQ",
 "OS::TripleO::Services::Loadbalancer",
 "OS::TripleO::Services::Memcached"]

Or for a plaintext list:

[root@overcloud-controller-0 ~]# ruby -e "puts $(hiera tripleo_services)"
OS::TripleO::Services::Keystone
OS::TripleO::Services::GlanceApi
OS::TripleO::Services::GlanceRegistry
OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronDhcpAgent
OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronL3Agent
OS::TripleO::Services::NeutronMetadataAgent
OS::TripleO::Services::RabbitMQ
OS::TripleO::Services::Loadbalancer
OS::TripleO::Services::Memcached

Change-Id: I6cd3d74a694ab741e007e44672569172b0d93012

commit_message:

Now, whether use sudo mode or not, "sudo" parameter

subject: Correct filters for resource search
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-17 09:18:52.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/api.py', 'heat/tests/engine/service/test_stack_resources.py', 'heat/engine/service.py'], 'message': 'Correct filters for resource search

We can search resources using this filter keys:
type, status, name, action, id, physical_resource_id. For more
information please see heat-stack-resource-search spec in heat-specs
repository and this commit: Iaae88f3b32bc2ba7b41a4078ef3aa8ffc07079b7
We pass `filters` as an argument to sqlalchemy that expects
filters keys to be a columns in a table. There are not such
columns `physical_resource_id`, `type` in Resource table, so
we get error while trying to filter resource by this keys.
Use `nova_instance` instead of `physical_resource_id` and filter
by `type` manually.

Closes-Bug: #1568974

Change-Id: I7b47eae000b244f58a05405746f5fcf9e922aff8
'}]
commit_message:
Correct filters for resource search

We can search resources using this filter keys:
type, status, name, action, id, physical_resource_id. For more
information please see heat-stack-resource-search spec in heat-specs
repository and this commit: Iaae88f3b32bc2ba7b41a4078ef3aa8ffc07079b7
We pass `filters` as an argument to sqlalchemy that expects
filters keys to be a columns in a table. There are not such
columns `physical_resource_id`, `type` in Resource table, so
we get error while trying to filter resource by this keys.
Use `nova_instance` instead of `physical_resource_id` and filter
by `type` manually.

Closes-Bug: #1568974

Change-Id: I7b47eae000b244f58a05405746f5fcf9e922aff8

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-09 00:23:21.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/test_managers.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/managers.py'], 'message': 'ml2: allow retry on retriabable db error by precommit

Db retriable error by precommit can be recovered with upper layer by
retry instead of converting into ML2MechanismDriverError.
Raise retriable db error instead of swallowing it and let upper layer to
retry.
Due to concurrency, db error by precommit is sometimes inevitable.
precommit may issue db transactions depending on mechanism driver, Some
operations on e.g. subnet, routers, touches many other resources (e.g. ip
allocation, ports) in single db transaction as well. And background
operation by mechanism driver (e.g. background sync, monitoring
resources periodically, etc) may touch those db tables with other
order.

Change-Id: Ifc670c1eb5801934bf46fdc23a7721ce4c2cfa6c
Closes-Bug: #1609184
Closes-Bug: #1609149
'}]
commit_message:
ml2: allow retry on retriabable db error by precommit

Db retriable error by precommit can be recovered with upper layer by
retry instead of converting into ML2MechanismDriverError.
Raise retriable db error instead of swallowing it and let upper layer to
retry.
Due to concurrency, db error by precommit is sometimes inevitable.
precommit may issue db transactions depending on mechanism driver, Some
operations on e.g. subnet, routers, touches many other resources (e.g. ip
allocation, ports) in single db transaction as well. And background
operation by mechanism driver (e.g. background sync, monitoring
resources periodically, etc) may touch those db tables with other
order.

Change-Id: Ifc670c1eb5801934bf46fdc23a7721ce4c2cfa6c
Closes-Bug: #1609184
Closes-Bug: #1609149

commit_message:
Add purge_config option for all configs

Adding a purge_config option for all configs (specifically left out
services/lbaas.pp and services/vpnaas.pp as they require default
entries). Adding this option for ease of management and readability.
If users wish, they can use this to ensure that only the options they
are setting make it into the configs.
  *rebased my changes

Change-Id: I2286acb350ae6300f2e4c8dd320f2534ddf09bf9
(cherry picked from commit b467edb2a357bf9c915689efc83ebe8630ee66d0)

commit_message:
Remove the ControllerCount constraint

Some deployments want to deploy zero controllers, and this will become
a more likely configuration when support for custom roles lands (e.g
a set of decomposed custom roles vs the monolithic controller role
may be deployed instead).

Closes-Bug: #1604777
Change-Id: Idb21779f3ad9d875576bdb5e6502ed27a72600ba
(cherry picked from commit ac1a10e26b0340c649c17d9cdbfa24979b6183cf)

commit_message:
Autogenerate the list of existing validations

Instead of having to manually update the README every time we add a new
validation or update the name of an existing one (potentially causing
merge conflicts on the way), this generates list of existing validations
from their metadata automatically.

So when we add a new validation, it will be added to the docs
automatically based on its name and groups.

Change-Id: Ib5d227d090624ff8844abb5e3fd53c002635705b

subject: Fix workflow and join completion logic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5558, 'name': 'Winson Chan', 'email': 'wcchan@stackstorm.com', 'username': 'winson-c-chan'}, {'_account_id': 6732, 'name': 'Lingxian Kong', 'email': 'anlin.kong@gmail.com', 'username': 'kong'}, {'_account_id': 7700, 'name': 'Nikolay Mahotkin', 'email': 'nikolay.makhotkin@gmail.com', 'username': 'nmakhotkin'}, {'_account_id': 8592, 'name': 'Anastasia Kuznetsova', 'email': 'akuznetsova@mirantis.com', 'username': 'nastya-kuz'}, {'_account_id': 8731, 'name': 'Renat Akhmerov', 'email': 'renat.akhmerov@gmail.com', 'username': 'rakhmerov'}, {'_account_id': 9029, 'name': 'Moshe Elisha', 'email': 'moshe.elisha@nokia.com', 'username': 'MosheElisha'}, {'_account_id': 9408, 'name': 'Michal Gershenzon', 'email': 'michal.gershenzon@gmail.com', 'username': 'Mgershen'}, {'_account_id': 18238, 'name': 'Hardik Parekh', 'email': 'hardik.parekh047@gmail.com', 'username': 'hparekh'}, {'_account_id': 19206, 'name': 'Dawid Deja', 'email': 'dawdej@gmail.com', 'username': 'ddeja'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-10 07:29:33.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_direct_workflow_rerun.py', 'mistral/workflow/base.py', 'mistral/engine/task_handler.py', 'mistral/workflow/reverse_workflow.py', 'mistral/engine/workflows.py', 'mistral/workflow/direct_workflow.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_join.py'], 'message': 'Fix workflow and join completion logic

* Workflow completion logic was previously taking tasks in
  WAITING state into account which doesn't make sense anymore
  with the new non-locking approach. We assume that any task
  is expected to get into a terminal state, we should normally
  have no hanging tasks.
* Join completion logic was too primitive before because it
  didn't take into account inbound tasks in ERROR state.
  Just using method _is_unsatisfied_join() was not enough
  because a decision on what join state should be is not
  binary, it may be "ok to run", "still blocked" or
  "it will never run and hence should fail".

Change-Id: Ibc2a7c678eb62ab3309a2279d722f76a3607aa69
'}]
commit_message:
Fix workflow and join completion logic

* Workflow completion logic was previously taking tasks in
  WAITING state into account which doesn't make sense anymore
  with the new non-locking approach. We assume that any task
  is expected to get into a terminal state, we should normally
  have no hanging tasks.
* Join completion logic was too primitive before because it
  didn't take into account inbound tasks in ERROR state.
  Just using method _is_unsatisfied_join() was not enough
  because a decision on what join state should be is not
  binary, it may be "ok to run", "still blocked" or
  "it will never run and hence should fail".

Change-Id: Ibc2a7c678eb62ab3309a2279d722f76a3607aa69

commit_message:
skip test_connectivity_between_vms_on_different_networks

This test doesn't work on OVH if we make it so that created guests
actually have the ability to talk to external networks. We're not
really sure why, but having guests be able to talk to external
networks is quite important from a devstack neutron default
perspective.

This is temporary so that we can move forward with the devstack switch
over to neutron, and we can figure out what needs to be addressed to
fix the bug in question.

Depends-On: Ia75068dcf36dff548170c0fa5482ca825f5a9758
(requirements fix)

Change-Id: Ia07cd8d8d88d445420f881df6aca4a77cf9468fb
Related-Bug: #1610994

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 16:14:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/networking-guide/source/config-ipv6.rst'], 'message': "Updates docs to add OVS support for IPv6 addresses as tunnel endpoints

commit_message:
Updates docs to add OVS support for IPv6 addresses as tunnel endpoints

Fix in the 'OpenStack control & management network considerations'
section. Previously it stated that Open vSwitch does not support
IPv6. This commit updates the documentation now that Open vSwitch
does support IPv6 endpoints.

Change-Id: I0c78ad45d50df8edf5424aed10ceddd22e824a16
Closes-Bug: #1602403

Add inter-cloud support

The goal of this patch is to enable connection between multiple
overlay network in deferent openstack clouds

This patch includes PEP8 fixes.

Change-Id: I082aa1e8bc575fa84d5fe692ea5303284c37fc2b

commit_message:
Unit tests: Use Properties objects instead of dicts

The Resource.update_template_diff_properties() method takes Properties
objects, not just dicts of user values, as arguments. This updates the
tests to pass the correct types.

Change-Id: I1a00a17aedbf459a3362ea77edf46d8dc5949b22
(cherry picked from commit 05007cf27ae8423266fd01e464b27124ad54e655)

commit_message:
verify the certificates presence

verify the presence of certificates in the directory,
which is configured in l2gateway_agent.ini.
if certificates are not present or not in the name which is
expected by the l2gateway agent in the configured directory,
then error is logged.

Change-Id: I0e62fde3685b5704afa42f8578bae195a836e75b
Closes-Bug: 1603875

subject: Fix environment-specific limiting for upgrade docs
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-09 12:31:11.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/_templates/layout.html', 'doc/source/post_deployment/upgrade.rst', 'doc/source/repositories.txt'], 'message': 'Fix environment-specific limiting for upgrade docs

We now properly tag the repository switching admonitions so that they
show up correctly with regards to the state of "Limit Environment
Specific Content" checkboxes for the "Upgrade Version" category.

This means we also have to add Kilo to Liberty upgrade tag so that
Liberty repos are properly tagged and hideable, even though Kilo to
Liberty upgrades aren't really supported. This peculiar situation will
resolve itself once we remove Liberty-specific steps from the
documentation.

Also a minor tweak is removing a TODO comment from the docs. We'll keep
tweaking the docs as we improve he upgrades experience in that regard.

Change-Id: I1f2c85d89016ce30f392fc05aa35d6796588d748
'}]
commit_message:
Fix environment-specific limiting for upgrade docs

We now properly tag the repository switching admonitions so that they
show up correctly with regards to the state of "Limit Environment
Specific Content" checkboxes for the "Upgrade Version" category.

This means we also have to add Kilo to Liberty upgrade tag so that
Liberty repos are properly tagged and hideable, even though Kilo to
Liberty upgrades aren't really supported. This peculiar situation will
resolve itself once we remove Liberty-specific steps from the
documentation.

Also a minor tweak is removing a TODO comment from the docs. We'll keep
tweaking the docs as we improve he upgrades experience in that regard.

Change-Id: I1f2c85d89016ce30f392fc05aa35d6796588d748

commit_message:
Add package create to openstack CLI

usage: openstack package create [-h] [-t <HEAT_TEMPLATE>]
                                [--classes-dir <CLASSES_DIRECTORY>]
                                [-r <RESOURCES_DIRECTORY>] [-n <DISPLAY_NAME>]
                                [--full-name <full-name>] [-a <AUTHOR>]
                                [--tags [<TAG1 TAG2> [<TAG1 TAG2> ...]]]
                                [-d <DESCRIPTION>] [-o <PACKAGE_NAME>]
                                [-u <UI_DEFINITION>] [--type <TYPE>]
                                [-l <LOGO>]

Create an application package.

Partially implements: blueprint openstack-client-plugin-support

Change-Id: I3d81540ede601fe96952dbda483b792924a6fac4

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-10 05:56:48.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/common/middleware/crypto/test_crypto_utils.py', 'test/unit/proxy/controllers/test_obj.py', 'test/unit/obj/test_server.py', 'test/probe/test_object_metadata_replication.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/crypto/test_decrypter.py', 'test/unit/container/test_backend.py', 'test/unit/common/test_swob.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/test_copy.py', 'test/probe/test_container_sync.py'], 'message': 'Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by using != operator to
compare two dicts. So is assertEqual() in testtools. assertEqual()
in testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and so on.
So we just call assertEqual() to make the unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I2f205bc3b20997396260a10572c4d43ab8a17bf7
'}]
commit_message:
Use assertEqual() instead of assertDictEqual()

In unittest2, assertDictEqual() is implemented by using != operator to
compare two dicts. So is assertEqual() in testtools. assertEqual()
in testtools is able to handle dict, list, set and so on.
So we just call assertEqual() to make the unit tests simpler.

Change-Id: I2f205bc3b20997396260a10572c4d43ab8a17bf7

The assertequal replace assertIsNone

There is a method, called assertIsNone can replace assertequal (None,...),
so I made a replacement, I think it helps to narrow scope of assertequal
function changes in the future

Related-Bug: 1569705

commit_message:
change default compute hostnames to compute

Before this, the names were overcloud-novacompute-*.  After this patch,
they'll be overcloud-compute-*.  This matches the standard for other
node types like blockstorage (not cinderstorage) and objectstorage
(not swiftstorage).

This also resolves some upgrade issues given older versions which had
previously defaulted to compute and not novacompute.

An environment file is added which will allow deployments that already
deployed with overcloud-novacompute-* hostnames to continue working.

Change-Id: Ieeca0462e068c6a05f04ac820b20e7fb80c603f9
Related-Bug: 1569705

commit_message:
Rollback router intf port update if csnat update fails

If a CSNAT port update fails when a subnet is added,
it will leave the regular updated router port in the
changed state since it's a separate port update with
a separate transaction. So when the CSNAT update fails
we need explicitly undo the 1st update with another update.

Closes-Bug: #1609693
Change-Id: If979aebbebf6da77f3fcec0cc7ec8b27e388aba4

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-04-14 15:36:52.000000000', 'files': ['environments/updates/update-from-overcloud-compute-hostnames.yaml'], 'message': "Retain existing ComputeHostnameFormat when upgrading older envs

As discussed at +bug/1569705 after an upgrade to liberty from an
older deployment, the hostname of the compute nodes is changed.

If we set the ComputeHostnameFormat in the upgrade-pacemaker-init
environment file parameter_defaults then we don't need to worry
about the new value being specified as default by the upgraded
overcloud.yaml since the parameter_defaults value is persisted
unless explicitly overridden with a new parameter_defaults value.

This is provided as a new environment file that needs to be
included in the first upgrade step when upgradinng from an
environment that has 'overcloud-compute-N' hostnames.

Change-Id: I2c12bd1abac65d7f13d8768f87c5ebda91164578
Related-Bug: 1569705
"}]
commit_message:
Retain existing ComputeHostnameFormat when upgrading older envs

As discussed at +bug/1569705 after an upgrade to liberty from an
older deployment, the hostname of the compute nodes is changed.

If we set the ComputeHostnameFormat in the upgrade-pacemaker-init
environment file parameter_defaults then we don't need to worry
about the new value being specified as default by the upgraded
overcloud.yaml since the parameter_defaults value is persisted
unless explicitly overridden with a new parameter_defaults value.

This is provided as a new environment file that needs to be
included in the first upgrade step when upgradinng from an
environment that has 'overcloud-compute-N' hostnames.

Change-Id: I2c12bd1abac65d7f13d8768f87c5ebda91164578
Related-Bug: 1569705

subject: Support hidden consistency groups
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-08-02 14:51:16.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/hidden-consistency-groups.rst'], 'message': 'Support hidden consistency groups

Adds a spec for supporting hidden consistency groups.

Currently when consistency groups are created they are owned by the
tenant and can be modified freely given the correct role. This means
that if a consistency group exists that is part of a tenant policy the
tenant can change it directly without going through the policy owner.
This in turn can cause issues with the entity who manages the
consistency group. Further more, the user might see consistency groups
that they did not create and might choose to delete it.

blueprint cinder-hidden-consistency-groups

Change-Id: Ib3a841d9e494482455d3285991bac3fb19aef4f7
Signed-off-by: Saggi Mizrahi <saggi.mizrahi@huawei.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Support hidden consistency groups

Adds a spec for supporting hidden consistency groups.

Currently when consistency groups are created they are owned by the
tenant and can be modified freely given the correct role. This means
that if a consistency group exists that is part of a tenant policy the
tenant can change it directly without going through the policy owner.
This in turn can cause issues with the entity who manages the
consistency group. Further more, the user might see consistency groups
that they did not create and might choose to delete it.

blueprint cinder-hidden-consistency-groups

Change-Id: Ib3a841d9e494482455d3285991bac3fb19aef4f7
Signed-off-by: Saggi Mizrahi <saggi.mizrahi@huawei.com>

Change-Id: Idde9655919dfb42b00f030d74c85ff09821e36ee
Closes-bug: 1611096
(cherry picked from commit 195853220d98b2b10e02621e9ac143bf9a45618f)
'}]
commit_message:
Force db_joined on action upgrade for nova-api db

On action managed upgrade db_joined was not called and the new required db,
nova-api, was not created when upgrading to mitaka.

Change-Id: Idde9655919dfb42b00f030d74c85ff09821e36ee
Closes-bug: 1611096
(cherry picked from commit 195853220d98b2b10e02621e9ac143bf9a45618f)

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 22:38:29.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Id88216090ea0ebdf9c1353eb713ccfed72c84630
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Id88216090ea0ebdf9c1353eb713ccfed72c84630

commit_message:
Fix string interpolation at logging call

Skip creating the formatted log message
if the message is not going to be emitted
because of the log level.

See the oslo i18n guideline.

* http://docs.openstack.org/developer/oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#\
  adding-variables-to-log-messages

Change-Id: Ie9f3c9179cdae57ee298149f829811a5422fb9aa
Closes-Bug: #1596829

commit_message:
Adding a purge_config option for nova_config

Adding a purge_config option for all configs. Adding this option for
ease of management and readability. If users wish, they can use this
to ensure that only the options they are setting make it into the
configs.

"}]
commit_message:
Correct reraising of exception

When an exception was caught and rethrown, it should call 'raise'
without any arguments because it shows the place where an exception
occured initially instead of place where the exception re-raised

Change-Id: I1535176b8264cfb8075132ce1071251055a635d9

commit_message:
Isolate conf params for iSCSI and FC multipath

Both FC & iSCSI drivers decide on multipath based on the
'iscsi_use_multipath' config parameter. The user ends up being
confused because both use same parameter.

Added separate parameter 'fc_use_multipath' for FC multipath.

DocImpact
Closes-Bug: #1555666

Change-Id: Iabebc1e7c9a924aa6d696872c716a89a8d380678

* Fixed 'with-items' to work in non-locking mode. 'concurrency'

* Fix reverse workflows to work in non-locking mode

Change-Id: I74bb252533ba4742eb3c7bde73e62ed61ed244bd

commit_message:
Towards non-locking model: make 'with-items' work w/o locks

* Fixed 'with-items' to work in non-locking mode. 'concurrency'
  task property has been temporarily dropped since its current
  implementation does not fit into transactional model. It
  needs to be re-implemented based on atomic DB reads/writes
  of a number of currently running actions which is now impossible
  to do with Json field 'runtime_context', most likely a new DB
  field is needed for this.

TODO:
* Fix 'concurrency'
* Fix reverse workflows to work in non-locking mode
* Remove locks

Partially implements: blueprint mistral-non-locking-tx-model
Change-Id: I74bb252533ba4742eb3c7bde73e62ed61ed244bd

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 23:00:36.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Iaa71926035889763ee733fe64ea2336d326faa5f
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Iaa71926035889763ee733fe64ea2336d326faa5f

commit_message:
Add producer to populate clouds by instances

We need to have an on-demand mechanism to boot
parameterized VMs stack for the further possibility to
get its status. For example, it will be useful
for testing of VM lifecycle during the upgrade of cloud

Change-Id: I3a4c6ba304690f1323db739dec2dcce5a8e6c183

[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-08-09 17:13:56.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/tests/tests_upgrade/test_data_driven_upgrade_base.py'], 'message': "Rewrite octane-related operations

Unfortunately octane can stuck in combination of paramiko+tons of logs.
Do not let it happens:
- Move any octane's output to files
- Add timeout to command
- Use new SSHClient's features
- Download octane's log from master node - diag snapshot can be broken
(see https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1604311 )

Change-Id: Ib942815d3a97795acbea4265c634cd801cae9f56
"}]
commit_message:
Rewrite octane-related operations

Unfortunately octane can stuck in combination of paramiko+tons of logs.
Do not let it happens:
- Move any octane's output to files
- Add timeout to command
- Use new SSHClient's features
- Download octane's log from master node - diag snapshot can be broken
(see https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1604311 )

Change-Id: Ib942815d3a97795acbea4265c634cd801cae9f56

commit_message:
Allow live-migration test fail

Some times live migration test could fail without any
upgrade-related reason. It shouldn't prevent execution of next tests

For details see
https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1471172
https://bugs.launchpad.net/fuel/+bug/1604749

Change-Id: I4076408a43ec2b6018878df4b949f99c2ba2a79e

commit_message:
Fix use of bootstrap_node in cinder base profile

By inspecting bootstrap_nodeid in cinder base profile we can
set sync_db appropriately and not always default to true.

Change-Id: I2484b1d70a17436c0d8eab9ea8df927d57783784

commit_message:
Fix mistral sync_db profile steps

The services in the mistral profiles were
limited to be executed only in the
bootstrap master node.

commit_message:
Add the jessie-newton-backports repo to sbuild

1/ Add the jessie-newton-backports to the sbuild chroot
2/ Use NODEPOOL_MIRROR_HOST instead of hardcoded rax.
3/ Make a fake mirror from jessie-newton-backports, not jessie-newton
4/ Attempt to build a backport for sphinx

Change-Id: I4f3624d2f83332878fe767b61c90b5788aa60f74

commit_message:
Port with_ loop variable syntax  to Ansbile 2

Migrate to full variable syntax in with_ loop
instead of bare variables for:
- ceph
- ceilometer
- glance
- heat
- horizon
- keystone
- mariadb
- memcached
- neutron
- nova
- rabbitmq

Change-Id: Ib925b4ecea47ac758a77739c9c7e140f06933b08
Partial-Implements: blueprint ansible2
