commit_message:
Implement horizon plugin model

This commit moves the horizon code from contrib/horizon to
congress_dashboard to install as plugin. Added README for the same.
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/horizon/tutorials/plugin.html
Note: Passes basic testing with v2 authentication
      This commit doesn't address issue with V3 authentication.It is being
      fixed as part of Bug: #1602837

Implements: blueprint congress-horizon-plugin
Change-Id: I06da4a47f61739635e6f1756f773b236ebde55c9

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 22:51:21.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I66d16a41c34bee399d5d11def0e6fefb91f42779
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I66d16a41c34bee399d5d11def0e6fefb91f42779

subject: Fix backup NFS share mount with default backup_mount_options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 09:59:02.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_nfs.py', 'cinder/backup/drivers/nfs.py'], 'message': "Fix backup NFS share mount with default backup_mount_options

Now, if backup_mount_options in not set, NFS Backup driver
passes empty dict to RemoteFsClient. It cause an error when
RemoteFsClient mounts the share because it passes '-o {}' params.

According to [1] we should pass None to RemoteFsClient if no
backup_mount_options was specified.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/remotefs/remotefs.py#L129-L130

Change-Id: Ief874332a71ff77c88a65e2d631457b831472236
Closes-Bug: #1529566
"}]
commit_message:
Fix backup NFS share mount with default backup_mount_options

Now, if backup_mount_options in not set, NFS Backup driver
passes empty dict to RemoteFsClient. It cause an error when
RemoteFsClient mounts the share because it passes '-o {}' params.

According to [1] we should pass None to RemoteFsClient if no
backup_mount_options was specified.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/remotefs/remotefs.py#L129-L130

Change-Id: Ief874332a71ff77c88a65e2d631457b831472236
Closes-Bug: #1529566

subject: Support HA for k8s coreos bay
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-08 23:33:05.000000000', 'files': ['magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/template_def.py', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/kubecluster.yaml', 'magnum/tests/unit/conductor/handlers/test_k8s_bay_conductor.py', 'magnum/drivers/k8s_coreos_v1/templates/kubemaster.yaml'], 'message': 'Support HA for k8s coreos bay

Following things has been added to make core OS driver HA
  1) Created two pools for API and etcd.
  2) Added health monitoring for both API and etcd.
  3) Register masters into the pool created at step 1 to
     balance load among them.

Address switcher has been added to
  1) If LBaaS is not enabled(1 master) then master IPs are
     exposed.
  2) If LBaaS is enabled(more than 1 master) then LBaaS IPs
     are exposed.

Co-Author-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin.lu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I96391076f17bdb7161455cea7732c0d85cb72fe0
Closes-bug: #1580220
'}]
commit_message:
Support HA for k8s coreos bay

Following things has been added to make core OS driver HA
  1) Created two pools for API and etcd.
  2) Added health monitoring for both API and etcd.
  3) Register masters into the pool created at step 1 to
     balance load among them.

Address switcher has been added to
  1) If LBaaS is not enabled(1 master) then master IPs are
     exposed.
  2) If LBaaS is enabled(more than 1 master) then LBaaS IPs
     are exposed.

Co-Author-By: Hongbin Lu <hongbin.lu@huawei.com>

Change-Id: I96391076f17bdb7161455cea7732c0d85cb72fe0
Closes-bug: #1580220

subject: Fix backup NFS share mount with default backup_mount_options
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 09:58:29.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/backup/drivers/test_backup_nfs.py', 'cinder/backup/drivers/nfs.py'], 'message': "Fix backup NFS share mount with default backup_mount_options

Now, if backup_mount_options in not set, NFS Backup driver
passes empty dict to RemoteFsClient. It cause an error when
RemoteFsClient mounts the share because it passes '-o {}' params.

According to [1] we should pass None to RemoteFsClient if no

commit_message:
Fix backup NFS share mount with default backup_mount_options

Now, if backup_mount_options in not set, NFS Backup driver
passes empty dict to RemoteFsClient. It cause an error when
RemoteFsClient mounts the share because it passes '-o {}' params.

According to [1] we should pass None to RemoteFsClient if no
backup_mount_options was specified.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/os-brick/blob/master/os_brick/remotefs/remotefs.py#L129-L130

Change-Id: Ief874332a71ff77c88a65e2d631457b831472236
Closes-Bug: #1529566

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 22:58:21.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I1a8c6e305ccb9244eb7c690a93921d0982b3ecbe
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: I1a8c6e305ccb9244eb7c690a93921d0982b3ecbe

commit_message:
Remove the ironic-parallel-nv from tempest experimental

The ironic-parallel-nv job on tempest does not actually run any tests.
My guess is that it's designed to be used with ironic's tempest plugin
(based on the selection regex used to cause [1]) But, since tempest
doesn't include that plugin the job doesn't have anything to run and
fails.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/56/347756/11/experimental/gate-tempest-dsvm-ironic-parallel-nv/3aa0f97/console.html#_2016-08-09_21_49_19_734536

Change-Id: Ie0b952217e20510aa538f6dec50a60c9361f4751

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-07-27 18:46:20.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/hardware.py', 'nova/scheduler/filters/numa_topology_filter.py', 'nova/tests/functional/libvirt/test_numa_servers.py'], 'message': "NUMA: include orphan threads with policy prefer

Previously, when calculating usable cores for NUMA pinning, the
prefer's policy logic was unable to take into account all usable
threads. This made it impossible to boot additional guests when some
of the available host threads were orphans. This patches changes this
logic to include all available threads when scheduling a VM and
calculating pinning.

In addition, some logging is added for easier future debugging, as

commit_message:
NUMA: include orphan threads with policy prefer

Previously, when calculating usable cores for NUMA pinning, the
prefer's policy logic was unable to take into account all usable
threads. This made it impossible to boot additional guests when some
of the available host threads were orphans. This patches changes this
logic to include all available threads when scheduling a VM and
calculating pinning.

In addition, some logging is added for easier future debugging, as
well a functional test for this bug.

Co-authored-by: Vladik Romanovsky <vromanso@redhat.com>
Closes-bug: 1578155
Change-Id: Ia319f2abbd17c9d0c28119b033d7924af2d9d184

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-06-17 09:45:19.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt', 'upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': 'Add selector to requirements

selector is a simple WSGI routing and delegation library that is
going to be used in the new placement API currently being built
in nova. selector is more lightweight, declarative, and
inspectable than the Routes library in common use throughout
OpenStack. There's an explicit goal in the placement API to
"use different stuff". selector is just one part of that.

selector's one dependency, resolver, is also added to
upper-constraints.

For the new requirements questions:

Is the library actively maintained?

  There hasn't been a release in quite a while but that is because
  selector is simple and stable, not because it is unattended.
  (More below).

Is the library good code?

  I've been using selector in other codebases for several years
  and it does what it says on the tin with alacrity.

Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

Is the library license compatible?

  Selector is dual licensed GPL and MIT. The author states it
  may be used with either license. We choose MIT.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

  No, but due to its limited surface area and minimal dependencies
  it should be straightforward.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?

  As described above the Routes package provides similar functionality
  but in such a different style that it would be incorrect to call
  them equivalent.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?

  Yes, as above, the plan is to use this with the new placement API
  being built in nova.

Code is at: https://github.com/lukearno/selector/
On PyPi at: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/selector

Change-Id: If1eb987fbe270e67a81005baa7f6f88c6586feef
'}]
commit_message:
Add selector to requirements

selector is a simple WSGI routing and delegation library that is
going to be used in the new placement API currently being built
in nova. selector is more lightweight, declarative, and
inspectable than the Routes library in common use throughout
OpenStack. There's an explicit goal in the placement API to
"use different stuff". selector is just one part of that.

selector's one dependency, resolver, is also added to
upper-constraints.

For the new requirements questions:

Is the library actively maintained?

  There hasn't been a release in quite a while but that is because
  selector is simple and stable, not because it is unattended.
  (More below).

Is the library good code?

  I've been using selector in other codebases for several years
  and it does what it says on the tin with alacrity.

Is the library python 3 compatible?

  Yes.

Is the library license compatible?

  Selector is dual licensed GPL and MIT. The author states it
  may be used with either license. We choose MIT.

Is the library already packaged in the distros we target?

  No, but due to its limited surface area and minimal dependencies
  it should be straightforward.

Is the function of this library already covered by other libraries
in global-requirements.txt?

  As described above the Routes package provides similar functionality
  but in such a different style that it would be incorrect to call
  them equivalent.

Is the library required for OpenStack project or related dev or
infrastructure setup?

  Yes, as above, the plan is to use this with the new placement API
  being built in nova.

Code is at: https://github.com/lukearno/selector/
On PyPi at: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/selector

Change-Id: If1eb987fbe270e67a81005baa7f6f88c6586feef

subject: Syncing address set IDs before starting to sync ports
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-08 12:52:29.000000000', 'files': ['networking_ovn/common/utils.py', 'networking_ovn/ovsdb/impl_idl_ovn.py', 'networking_ovn/ml2/mech_driver.py', 'networking_ovn/ovn_db_sync.py'], 'message': 'Syncing address set IDs before starting to sync ports

Imagine if networking-ovn starts with an empty OVN NB but with some data in
Neutron DB, during the case of Neutron migration to ml2/ovn. The Address set
IDs will not be present before creating ACLs for the ports.

This patch syncs just the Address Set ids from security group ids, before
attempting to sync networks and ports. The values of the Address_Set addresses
will be populated once the ACLs are synced

Change-Id: Iadc89941004c1ba4958bc4b99b3435998679e6bd
'}]
commit_message:
Syncing address set IDs before starting to sync ports

Imagine if networking-ovn starts with an empty OVN NB but with some data in
Neutron DB, during the case of Neutron migration to ml2/ovn. The Address set
IDs will not be present before creating ACLs for the ports.

This patch syncs just the Address Set ids from security group ids, before
attempting to sync networks and ports. The values of the Address_Set addresses
will be populated once the ACLs are synced

Change-Id: Iadc89941004c1ba4958bc4b99b3435998679e6bd

subject: try harder to update constraint when a library is released
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-09 21:05:26.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/release-tools/release.sh'], 'message': "try harder to update constraint when a library is released

Some of the libraries are listed in the constraints file using the name
found in setup.cfg and some are listed using their canonical name. There
doesn't seem to be any pattern to which is which, so just try to update
both names under the assumption that only one will be present or if for
some unforeseen reason both are there that we want them to be the same
anyway.

Change-Id: Ia02a4c4365f1e0eb60f186c12a0c16849030c8a5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
try harder to update constraint when a library is released

Some of the libraries are listed in the constraints file using the name
found in setup.cfg and some are listed using their canonical name. There
doesn't seem to be any pattern to which is which, so just try to update
both names under the assumption that only one will be present or if for
some unforeseen reason both are there that we want them to be the same
anyway.

Change-Id: Ia02a4c4365f1e0eb60f186c12a0c16849030c8a5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Fix encryption-delimiter interaction

Previously, if a container listing produced `subdir` elements
the decrypter would raise a KeyError.

Additionally, update the functests so this sort of thing would
have been caught at the gate.

Closes-Bug: 1609904
Change-Id: Idc1907d19f90af7a086f45f8faecee9fbc3c69c2

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-09 09:15:41.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/aws/test_instance.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': "Set properties to before_props before calling handle_update

For some resources, we need to get the old properties
while handle_update, e.g. for nova server resource, we
calculate networks from old_nets and new_nets when update
the server networks, but the properties of server is updated
after rsrc_defn reparsing. So let's set the properties to
before_props before calling handle_update.

Change-Id: I24fea225a2749ee9baaa6273b78eed8126eb9e95
Closes-Bug: #1584623
"}]
commit_message:
Set properties to before_props before calling handle_update

For some resources, we need to get the old properties
while handle_update, e.g. for nova server resource, we
calculate networks from old_nets and new_nets when update
the server networks, but the properties of server is updated
after rsrc_defn reparsing. So let's set the properties to
before_props before calling handle_update.

Change-Id: I24fea225a2749ee9baaa6273b78eed8126eb9e95
Closes-Bug: #1584623

commit_message:
Reset Cgsnapshot state

Currently a user can create Cgsnapshot from a Consistency Group.But there's
no single API that allows a user to reset the state of cgsnapshot.
In this spec, we propose to provide a cgsnapshot API that can be supported
to reset cgsnapshot state.

Change-Id: Idc86f07c6ff664bed6e570ee2d19b29807d65920
blueprint: cgsnapshot-reset-state

commit_message:
Add images_panel parameter default to HORIZON_CONFIG

Review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/339122/ adds parameter
images_panel to HORIZON_CONFIG dict. It requires a default value
to work properly.

This patch add parameter images_panel to set the enabled panel
to legacy (default value) or angular.

Change-Id: I50ca03492464f9fb2f84963352b2e65c14d44953

revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2016-08-05 01:50:23.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': "Use stashed volume connector in _local_cleanup_bdm_volumes

When we perform a local delete in the compute API during the volumes
cleanup, Nova calls the volume_api.terminate_connection passing a fake
volume connector. That call is useless and it has no real effect on the
volume server side.

With a686185fc02ec421fd27270a343c19f668b95da6 in mitaka we started
stashing the connector in the bdm.connection_info so this change
tries to use that if it's available, which it won't be for attachments
made before that change -or- for volumes attached to an instance in
shelved_offloaded state that were never unshelved (because the actual
volume attach for those instances happens on the compute manager after
you unshelve the instance).

If we can't find a stashed connector, or we find one whose host does
not match the instance.host, we punt and just don't call
terminate_connection at all since calling it with a fake connector
can actually make some cinder volume backends fail and then the
volume is orphaned.

Closes-Bug: #1609984

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9f9ead51238e27fa45084c8e3d3edee76a8b0218
"}]
commit_message:
Use stashed volume connector in _local_cleanup_bdm_volumes

When we perform a local delete in the compute API during the volumes
cleanup, Nova calls the volume_api.terminate_connection passing a fake
volume connector. That call is useless and it has no real effect on the
volume server side.

With a686185fc02ec421fd27270a343c19f668b95da6 in mitaka we started
stashing the connector in the bdm.connection_info so this change
tries to use that if it's available, which it won't be for attachments
made before that change -or- for volumes attached to an instance in
shelved_offloaded state that were never unshelved (because the actual
volume attach for those instances happens on the compute manager after
you unshelve the instance).

If we can't find a stashed connector, or we find one whose host does
not match the instance.host, we punt and just don't call
terminate_connection at all since calling it with a fake connector
can actually make some cinder volume backends fail and then the
volume is orphaned.

Closes-Bug: #1609984

Co-Authored-By: Matt Riedemann <mriedem@us.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I9f9ead51238e27fa45084c8e3d3edee76a8b0218

subject: Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 22:48:01.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Ie60098bda3c4f13fc05e02fed33de266fc379d0b
'}]
commit_message:
Enable DeprecationWarning in test environments

Many deprecations are triggered early (on imports, for example)
before the warnings are enabled by the WarningsFixture in the
base test class.

To make sure all DeprecationWarning messages are emitted we enable
them via the PYTHONWARNINGS environment variable.

Change-Id: Ie60098bda3c4f13fc05e02fed33de266fc379d0b

commit_message:
Introduce a script to launch ovsdb-server process

The reason for introducing this script is to be able
to launch ovsdb-server and initialize it (create external bridge and plug
external interface) in one shot. It is applicable ONLY to Kubernetes environment
and it is required for Kubernetes DaemonSet usage. The behavior in classical
Kolla has not been changed.

TrivialFix

Change-Id: I54897cc2c0f2bcaaf0411822f3409bf96e92833d

commit_message:
Scrap testHA:test_datasource_db_sync_remove

The test is redundant because removal by db sync is already tested
in test_datasource_db_sync_add. The test also causes frequent
transient failures.

The following bug not completely closed because there appears to be
deeper issues causing the failure. To be addressed in coming days.

Submitting this quick fix to unjam the current gating process holding
up ready and to-be-ready patches.

Change-Id: If7013ef8afa9b3b9cbe773ba1393f5f822f60003
Partial-bug: 1611467

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-06-06 18:52:56.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': 'Set deploywait_timeout via localrc option

Currently a hardcoded value is used for the DEPLOYWAIT timeout in
tempest. The patch in review 269249 adds a config option to use
instead of this hardcoded value. This patch allows the value to be
set via the BUILD_TIMEOUT variable.

Change-Id: Id79014fd6e07f93029111f6c28e3537e2e39be9f
Related-Bug: 1526466
'}]
commit_message:
Set deploywait_timeout via localrc option

Currently a hardcoded value is used for the DEPLOYWAIT timeout in
tempest. The patch in review 269249 adds a config option to use
instead of this hardcoded value. This patch allows the value to be
set via the BUILD_TIMEOUT variable.

Change-Id: Id79014fd6e07f93029111f6c28e3537e2e39be9f
Related-Bug: 1526466

commit_message:
Adding support for Magnum

In addition to adding the magnum role to the repo build process we also
include the os-magnum-install.yml to deploy magnum to hosts tagged with
os_magnum.

Change-Id: I32dee168d1005572510f630a21f7d7a7a05640d9
Implements: blueprint role-magnum

commit_message:
Add event_pipeline.yaml management

Allow event_pipeline.yaml to have publishers specified. This is
required to support aodh event alarms by pushing notifications
to an alarm queue as described here:

http://docs.openstack.org/developer/aodh/event-alarm.html

Change-Id: If367192f9c0214b3b4462788024dd9222dff558e
Signed-off-by: Michael Chapman <woppin@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add Fedora 24 work-around kernel

The current F24 kernel can't run tempest without oops-ing.  This
installs a custom build with a fix until we get a fixed release.

See also

 https://git.kernel.org/cgit/linux/kernel/git/davem/net.git/commit/?id=5ef9f289c4e698054e5687edb54f0da3cdc9173a
 https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1361414

Change-Id: I0769f005da1931658a5fb9e627983ed30c11d212

commit_message:
Force Elasticsearch indexing

Aded a new option to the searchlight-maange index
command. This will force all indexing to occur
from Elasticsearch. No plugin APIs will be used.

Change-Id: I1c18b2ee4e916430de0cdfd162494d6cab4babb1
Implements: blueprint allow-reindexing-into-new-mapping

commit_message:
Start Ocata specs proposals

Some of the Newton specs did not get enough attention from cores
during the cycle. Let's start the Ocata folder for starting planning on
the specs for next cycle.

This needs to be started/merged in Newton for people to start planning
on writing specs and then help the glance team and community
determine/plan work for Ocata.

Co-Authored-By: Nikhil Komawar <nik.komawar@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-By: Brian Rosmaita <brian.rosmaita@rackspace.com>

Change-Id: I16d1dd18c3efceb2245239f9c95483e717c70c4d

Collins', 'email': 'sean@coreitpro.com', 'username': 'scollins'}, {'_account_id': 5196, 'name': 'Matthew Treinish', 'email': 'mtreinish@kortar.org', 'username': 'treinish'}, {'_account_id': 6672, 'name': 'Geronimo Orozco', 'email': 'geronimo.orozco@intel.com', 'username': 'gorozco'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 18462, 'name': 'Rahul U Nair', 'email': 'rahulunair@gmail.com', 'username': 'rahulunair'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-08-04 18:19:31.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron_plugins/services/l3', 'lib/nova', 'stackrc'], 'message': "Change to neutron by default.

nova-net is deprecated, and it's long time to switch to neutron by
default. This patch does that, and has an auto configuration mode that
mostly just works for the basic case.

It does this by assuming that unless the user specifies an interface
for it to manage, that it will not automatically have access to a
physical interface. The floating range is put on br-ex (per normal),
fixed ranges stay on their OVS interfaces.

Because there is no dedicated interface managed by neutron, we add an
iptables rule which allows guests to route out. While somewhat
synthetic, it does provide a working out of the box developer
experience, and is not hugely more synthetic then all the other
interface / route setup we have to do for the system.

You should be able to run this with a local.conf of just

[[local|localrc]]
ADMIN_PASSWORD=pass
DATABASE_PASSWORD=pass
RABBIT_PASSWORD=pass
SERVICE_PASSWORD=pass

And get a working neutron on a single interface box

Documentation will come in subsequent patches, however getting the
code out there and getting feedback is going to help shape this
direction.

Change-Id: I185325a684372e8a2ff25eae974a9a2a2d6277e0
"}]
commit_message:
Change to neutron by default.

nova-net is deprecated, and it's long time to switch to neutron by
default. This patch does that, and has an auto configuration mode that
mostly just works for the basic case.

It does this by assuming that unless the user specifies an interface
for it to manage, that it will not automatically have access to a
physical interface. The floating range is put on br-ex (per normal),
fixed ranges stay on their OVS interfaces.

Because there is no dedicated interface managed by neutron, we add an
iptables rule which allows guests to route out. While somewhat
synthetic, it does provide a working out of the box developer
experience, and is not hugely more synthetic then all the other
interface / route setup we have to do for the system.

You should be able to run this with a local.conf of just

[[local|localrc]]
ADMIN_PASSWORD=pass
DATABASE_PASSWORD=pass
RABBIT_PASSWORD=pass
SERVICE_PASSWORD=pass

And get a working neutron on a single interface box

Documentation will come in subsequent patches, however getting the
code out there and getting feedback is going to help shape this
direction.

Change-Id: I185325a684372e8a2ff25eae974a9a2a2d6277e0

subject: User-agent header shouldn't start with a space
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 8482, 'name': 'Colleen Murphy', 'email': 'colleen@gazlene.net', 'username': 'krinkle'}, {'_account_id': 13181, 'name': 'Matt Mulsow', 'email': 'mamulsow@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'mamulsow'}, {'_account_id': 20089, 'name': 'Shawn Berger', 'email': 'slberger@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'slberger'}, {'_account_id': 22478, 'name': 'Benjamin VanHavermaet', 'email': 'bvanhav@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'bvanhav'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-09 15:59:11.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/session.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_session.py'], 'message': "User-agent header shouldn't start with a space

If the application name, sys.argv[0], is an empty string, like when
called from the Ansible os_network module, then keystoneauth (with
the new requests 2.11.0) will raise an exception saying:

Invalid return character or leading space in header: User-Agent

This comes from keystoneauth trying to prepend the empty module
name to the default user agent, which leads to it sending a
User-Agent header that starts with a blank space. This was fine
until the new requests 2.11.0 was released which errors if header
values start with a leading space.

With this change, if sys.argv[0] is an empty string we'll just use
the DEFAULT_USER_AGENT and not try to prepend a calling module.

Closes-Bug: #1611426

Change-Id: I56d3e352dce7628add0479b3333a880700844ebc
Signed-off-by: Matt Mulsow <mamulsow@us.ibm.com>
"}]
commit_message:
User-agent header shouldn't start with a space

If the application name, sys.argv[0], is an empty string, like when
called from the Ansible os_network module, then keystoneauth (with
the new requests 2.11.0) will raise an exception saying:

Invalid return character or leading space in header: User-Agent

This comes from keystoneauth trying to prepend the empty module
name to the default user agent, which leads to it sending a
User-Agent header that starts with a blank space. This was fine
until the new requests 2.11.0 was released which errors if header
values start with a leading space.

With this change, if sys.argv[0] is an empty string we'll just use
the DEFAULT_USER_AGENT and not try to prepend a calling module.

Closes-Bug: #1611426

Change-Id: I56d3e352dce7628add0479b3333a880700844ebc
Signed-off-by: Matt Mulsow <mamulsow@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
Keystone v2 and v3 manual and amulet/bundle testing

This provides both keystone v2 and v3 setup for testing barbican
manually.  It demonstrates how to set up a project/tenant in each v3 and
v2 and the how to store a secret.  Then only differences are in the
authentication with Keystone.  However, it does demonstrate both
working.

This change also contains the v2 and v3 keystone tests with barbican.
These are pesented as two gate-*-v2 and gate-*-v3 tests which activate
testing with keystone v2 and keystone v3.

Change-Id: Id0310da7a80ee8796eeda52b7af936ae51ed0dd9

commit_message:
Add some logging and a comment for shelve/unshelve operations

Since shelve_instance calls shelve_offload_instance it would
be useful to have some logging when we start those operations.
Do the same for unshelve since that is currently being called
during a Tempest run while shelve_offload_instance is still
running.

Also add a comment about why we have to set the instance.vm_state
before updating the resource tracker in shelve_offload_instance.

Change-Id: Ib9c08e4f9becf9500599d20e8f93ac75f2a77b5f
Related-Bug: #1611008

commit_message:
devstackgaterc: Skip test_router_interface_status for ML2

We currently never update status of purely logical ports
(in MidoNet term, interior ports) like router interfaces.
It ought to be fixed, but in case of ML2 it needs some mechanism
in ML2 driver api. [1]
For now, just skip the relevant test.

[1] Something like https://review.openstack.org/#/c/336068/

Closes-Bug: #1608796
Related-Bug: #1507453
Change-Id: Ie0123333edfbb9681f166519cbd6d7d8dae5f2ae

subject: Run shelve/shelve_offload_instance in a semaphore
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 7, 'name': 'Jay Pipes', 'email': 'jaypipes@gmail.com', 'username': 'jaypipes'}, {'_account_id': 5441, 'name': 'Andrew Laski', 'email': 'andrew@lascii.com', 'username': 'alaski'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15286, 'name': 'XenProject CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@xenproject.org', 'username': 'XenProject-CI', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-08 18:42:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Run shelve/shelve_offload_instance in a semaphore

When an instance is shelved, by default it is immediately
offloaded because CONF.shelved_offload_time defaults to 0.

When a shelved instance is offloaded, it's destroyed and it's
host/node values are nulled out.

Unshelving an instance is basically the same flow as building
an instance for the first time. The instance.host/node values
are set in the resource tracker when claiming resources.

Tempest has some tests which use a shared server resource and
perform actions on that shared server. These tests are triggering
a race when unshelve is called while the compute is offloading
the shelved instance. The race hits a window where unshelve is
running before shelve_offload_instance nulls out the instance
host/node values. The resource claim during unshelve sets the
host/node values (which were actually already set) and then
shelve_offload_instance nulls them out. The unshelve operation
sets the instance.vm_state to ACTIVE, however. So Tempest sees
an instance that's ACTIVE and thinks it can run the next action
test on it, for example 'suspend'. This fails because the
instance.host isn't set (from shelve_offload_instance) and the
test fails in the compute API.

To close the race window, we add a lock to shelve_instance and
shelve_offload_instance to match the lock that's in
unshelve_instance. This way when unshelve is called it will
wait until the shelve_offload_instance operation is complete
and the instance.host value is nulled out.

Closes-Bug: #1611008

Change-Id: Id36b3b9516d72d28519c18c38d98b646b47d288d
"}]
commit_message:
Run shelve/shelve_offload_instance in a semaphore

When an instance is shelved, by default it is immediately
offloaded because CONF.shelved_offload_time defaults to 0.

When a shelved instance is offloaded, it's destroyed and it's
host/node values are nulled out.

Unshelving an instance is basically the same flow as building
an instance for the first time. The instance.host/node values
are set in the resource tracker when claiming resources.

Tempest has some tests which use a shared server resource and
perform actions on that shared server. These tests are triggering
a race when unshelve is called while the compute is offloading
the shelved instance. The race hits a window where unshelve is
running before shelve_offload_instance nulls out the instance
host/node values. The resource claim during unshelve sets the
host/node values (which were actually already set) and then
shelve_offload_instance nulls them out. The unshelve operation
sets the instance.vm_state to ACTIVE, however. So Tempest sees
an instance that's ACTIVE and thinks it can run the next action
test on it, for example 'suspend'. This fails because the
instance.host isn't set (from shelve_offload_instance) and the
test fails in the compute API.

To close the race window, we add a lock to shelve_instance and
shelve_offload_instance to match the lock that's in
unshelve_instance. This way when unshelve is called it will
wait until the shelve_offload_instance operation is complete
and the instance.host value is nulled out.

Closes-Bug: #1611008

Change-Id: Id36b3b9516d72d28519c18c38d98b646b47d288d

commit_message:
BGP: exclude legacy fip in DVR fip host routes query

When query a bgpspeaker's routes, the DVR fip host routes query
will get the routes including the central fip routes. This will
let the central fip has more than one next_hop routes.

This patch adds a RouterExtraAttributes check for the distributed
routers during the DVR fip host routes query.

Closes-Bug: #1608406
(cherry picked from neutron-dynamic-routing commit
11965147fea9a52156ac2be265a5662973a4e5ad)

Change-Id: Ie174a7616eba36c690bda84d225538c03391f968

commit_message:
Fix tarball generation error due to missing tacker.conf

Sample tacker.conf is no longer included in the source
tree, instead the installer is expected to generate it.
Hence reference to etc/tacker/tacker.conf in setup.cfg
needs to be removed.

Closes-Bug: #1609739
Change-Id: I5abd6c95e93ed02740a061e1d9347774a3ce8c73

commit_message:
Delete HA network if last HA router is migrated

If an HA router is deleted and it's the last one a tenant has, the HA
network is deleted as it's no longer needed. The same should occur when
migrating the last HA router of a tenant from HA to Legacy.

Closes-Bug: #1610645
Change-Id: Ib27224c028bef98b78a5cea91e62ea98a2847008

commit_message:
Add force-delete into compute service

The exposed server delete is a soft action, which will cause unexpected
result if admin wants to delete the instance immediately. This patch
is to add interfaces for this purpose.

Change-Id: Ibfc4887e4bc367739b8945251e26d6d62117e3f2

commit_message:
Add services operations into compute service

Nova has allowed to enable/disable/force_down services. This patch
is to add these interfaces into compute services. One direct use case
is in Senlin for fencing purpose.

subject: Fix nova server image and flavor
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 11:11:14.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/compute/v2/server.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/compute/v2/test_server.py'], 'message': "Fix nova server image and flavor

The Json response from nova server now contains a 'image' key and a
'flavor' key both of which are maps. When doing a server GET, we are
supposed to get those attributes directly. This patch adds the 'image'
and the 'flavor' properties.

Change-Id: I99bce08c80124d3b420785410b63e46c02ea6259
"}]
commit_message:
Fix nova server image and flavor

The Json response from nova server now contains a 'image' key and a
'flavor' key both of which are maps. When doing a server GET, we are
supposed to get those attributes directly. This patch adds the 'image'
and the 'flavor' properties.

Change-Id: I99bce08c80124d3b420785410b63e46c02ea6259

commit_message:
Adding common PV and PVC scripts to ./service/common folder

Since PV and PVC templates are identical for all sercices, this PS makles them
a common template. Required size parameter will be passed from service_resources.yaml
After it is commited Mariadb and Glance will be repoted to use these scripts.

TrivialFix

revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-08-02 14:57:40.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/hacking/checks.py', 'test-requirements.txt', 'doc/source/usage.rst', 'neutron_lib/tests/unit/hacking/test_checks.py', 'neutron_lib/hacking/translation_checks.py', 'setup.cfg', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Update hacking check consumption

This patch updates our hacking checks as follows:
- Hacking checks are now registered via entry points so
they can be used via flake8 CLI. By default they are disabled.
Hacking check doc string is also updated to support pep8
parsing of check code.
- The existing hacking.checks.factory() is moved to a more
meaningful name; marking as deprecated.
- A private neutron-lib specific hacking check factory is provided
and used in tox.ini.
- A flake8 plugin is provided that supports the ability to use our
hacking check factory functions to enable a pre-existing check
by default.
- Our usage of hacking checks is updated to reflect our consumption
model for adopters.
- Unit tests are provided.

Change-Id: I88dad7f7cce4d4f5af679272f067c3bb4a73803a
'}]
commit_message:
Update hacking check consumption

This patch updates our hacking checks as follows:
- Hacking checks are now registered via entry points so
they can be used via flake8 CLI. By default they are disabled.
Hacking check doc string is also updated to support pep8
parsing of check code.
- The existing hacking.checks.factory() is moved to a more
meaningful name; marking as deprecated.
- A private neutron-lib specific hacking check factory is provided
and used in tox.ini.
- A flake8 plugin is provided that supports the ability to use our
hacking check factory functions to enable a pre-existing check
by default.
- Our usage of hacking checks is updated to reflect our consumption
model for adopters.
- Unit tests are provided.

Change-Id: I88dad7f7cce4d4f5af679272f067c3bb4a73803a

subject: Fix str_split function when string is None
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-02 10:05:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/hot/functions.py', 'heat/tests/test_hot.py'], 'message': 'Fix str_split function when string is None

Currently str_split raises error, when function take string to split as
NoneType object (e.g. get_attr value during validation). Fix such
behaviour to allow resources with str_split in properties pass
validation.

Change-Id: Iabd8ebb90a38253434e7c29005654c9a6abb3196
Closes-bug: #1608482
(cherry-picked from Iabd8ebb90a38253434e7c29005654c9a6abb3196)

commit_message:
Fix str_split function when string is None

Currently str_split raises error, when function take string to split as
NoneType object (e.g. get_attr value during validation). Fix such
behaviour to allow resources with str_split in properties pass
validation.

Change-Id: Iabd8ebb90a38253434e7c29005654c9a6abb3196
Closes-bug: #1608482
(cherry-picked from Iabd8ebb90a38253434e7c29005654c9a6abb3196)

subject: Ignore errors deserializing revocation events
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-03 21:47:37.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/models/revoke_model.py'], 'message': "Ignore errors deserializing revocation events

Rather than fail if the data returned from the cache is invalid,
just return that there's no data present. Typically, when there's
a cache problem (e.g., if memcache is unreachable) the error is
ignored and doesn't cause operations to fail.

NOTE: Maybe I should move this up the stack and handle it in
keystone/common/cache/_context_cache.py ?

Change-Id: I70cfb6c4547275f8ff6d7d73459e77bb41ed79d8
Closes-Bug: 1609566
"}]
commit_message:
Ignore errors deserializing revocation events

Rather than fail if the data returned from the cache is invalid,
just return that there's no data present. Typically, when there's
a cache problem (e.g., if memcache is unreachable) the error is
ignored and doesn't cause operations to fail.

NOTE: Maybe I should move this up the stack and handle it in
keystone/common/cache/_context_cache.py ?

Change-Id: I70cfb6c4547275f8ff6d7d73459e77bb41ed79d8
Closes-Bug: 1609566

subject: Update devstack configure_ironic_ssh_keypair
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-09 05:56:27.000000000', 'files': ['devstack/lib/ironic'], 'message': "Update devstack configure_ironic_ssh_keypair

When authorized_file doesn't contain new-line character at the end,
configure_ironic_ssh_keypair() just append new key to the existed line,
as result both keys becomes corrupted. The patch adds a check for
last character in the authorized_key file, if new-line is missed
add it.

Change-Id: I64a7bba5f3c7dee76ae2faf659af1231280f2b8b
Closes-Bug: #1611207
"}]
commit_message:
Update devstack configure_ironic_ssh_keypair

When authorized_file doesn't contain new-line character at the end,
configure_ironic_ssh_keypair() just append new key to the existed line,
as result both keys becomes corrupted. The patch adds a check for
last character in the authorized_key file, if new-line is missed
add it.

Change-Id: I64a7bba5f3c7dee76ae2faf659af1231280f2b8b
Closes-Bug: #1611207

This change includes the necessary refactoring to make the Image v2
service use the newer resource and proxy classes. Additionally, it
rearranged some of the structure of the Image resource in order to work
more logically on the surface of the proxy.

1. What was known as the Tag resource is now served by methods on the
Image resource, as tags are specific to an Image and not well served to
be thought of as their own thing. The behavior and tests have been moved
under Image, and at the proxy layer the calls were name "add_tag" and
"remove tag"
2. Image now supports the "deactivate" and "reactivate" actions.
3. The upload_image call was restructured slightly and is now helpfully
strict on the arguments it requires, as it takes two separate REST calls
in order to complete the operation.
4. download_image was added, and it verifies the checksum of the image
before returning the raw data. We previously converged on
download_<resource> as the naming convention of data being downloaded,
but we hadn't figured out what should be returned. A comment was added
to download_object in object_store as it currently tries to work with
writing to a file, which it should not do. That will be handled in that
service's refactor.

Change-Id: I22739d8a5b6c13552c9bdd980af0c2d62a66668d
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor image v2 to use resource2/proxy2

This change includes the necessary refactoring to make the Image v2
service use the newer resource and proxy classes. Additionally, it
rearranged some of the structure of the Image resource in order to work
more logically on the surface of the proxy.

1. What was known as the Tag resource is now served by methods on the
Image resource, as tags are specific to an Image and not well served to
be thought of as their own thing. The behavior and tests have been moved
under Image, and at the proxy layer the calls were name "add_tag" and
"remove tag"
2. Image now supports the "deactivate" and "reactivate" actions.
3. The upload_image call was restructured slightly and is now helpfully
strict on the arguments it requires, as it takes two separate REST calls
in order to complete the operation.
4. download_image was added, and it verifies the checksum of the image
before returning the raw data. We previously converged on
download_<resource> as the naming convention of data being downloaded,
but we hadn't figured out what should be returned. A comment was added
to download_object in object_store as it currently tries to work with
writing to a file, which it should not do. That will be handled in that
service's refactor.

Change-Id: I22739d8a5b6c13552c9bdd980af0c2d62a66668d

commit_message:
Add long option to network trunk list command

This patch adds a '--long' option to trunk list OSC CLI. Using
'--long' option will now allow user to see additional fields
while listing all trunks.

This patch is also a follow up patch for change
I6fe1dbd81813fae234801a61c0e3d89f9e7c791e to address multiple
TODOs like importing modules from osc-lib instead direct imports
and adding exception handling for NetworkTrunkSet command with
appropriate unit tests.

Change-Id: Iae1801b0b4f6bc2ca434290041ab5277285e400b

that there is no way to specify for insecure magnumclient
as a result api throws 500 and SSL cert verify errors.

Create a higher priority queue for checking release patches and move the
jobs for openstack/releases into it. The goal of doing this is to reduce
the wait time for release processing on busy days when there are a lot
of other patches in the normal check queue. The jobs in question are
pretty quick, but we still often end up waiting a long time for them to

commit_message:
create release-check high priority queue

Create a higher priority queue for checking release patches and move the
jobs for openstack/releases into it. The goal of doing this is to reduce
the wait time for release processing on busy days when there are a lot
of other patches in the normal check queue. The jobs in question are
pretty quick, but we still often end up waiting a long time for them to
start, which delays releases that may be needed to fix issues that are
going to cause other jobs to fail anyway.

Change-Id: I3df8171e6bb3b94d9cc0058519275644dccaa9b2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Introduce type:deployment tag

There are at laest six deployment projects in the governance repository
at present including Chef, Fuel, OSA, Puppet, Kolla, TripleO.  Some of
the tags may need special logic to handle deployment projects.  For
example the assert type classification has hard-coded requirements for
type:service in assert:supports-upgrade which will require modification
to implement proper tagging of deployment tools which implement
upgrade processes.

Since deployment has become a type by de-facto development, it
makes sense to inform Operators that the project is a deployment
project via OpenStack's various automated tooling.  Further as
is, deployment projects are sometimes excluded from asserting
certain tags that they already meet or could easily meet because
they are limited to only type:service.

Change-Id: I4b342430f1d0db269d7b88d6b4226108fae4e370

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-03-28 20:29:12.000000000', 'files': ['reference/tags/type_packaging.rst'], 'message': 'Introduce a type:packaging tag

This tag represents projects which package OpenStack software into
distinct units for consumption by deployment tools.  The packaging
model is left to discretion of individual who tags the repository.

At this time, I believe this packaging model would apply to deb files,
dib elements, docker files, and rpm files.

The value of this change is to properly tag our repositories so
Operators can determine which repositories are responsible for
creating packaged versions of OpenStack compute-kit software (at
minimum).

Change-Id: I81a7d9d0d5a08987540763409bf2f04d7823ca92
'}]
commit_message:
Introduce a type:packaging tag

This tag represents projects which package OpenStack software into
distinct units for consumption by deployment tools.  The packaging
model is left to discretion of individual who tags the repository.

At this time, I believe this packaging model would apply to deb files,
dib elements, docker files, and rpm files.

The value of this change is to properly tag our repositories so
Operators can determine which repositories are responsible for
creating packaged versions of OpenStack compute-kit software (at
minimum).

Change-Id: I81a7d9d0d5a08987540763409bf2f04d7823ca92

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 17:32:32.000000000', 'files': ['reference/projects.yaml'], 'message': 'Trim tc-approved-release tag to just base IaaS projects

This commit removes the tc-approved-release tag from non-base IaaS
projects. This tag is only used for marking which projects the TC
says can be included in defcore. When it was first created "the
integrated release" at the time was used to initially populate it.
However, just as with most things in the pre-big-tent world this
wasn't actually a good answer. The tag should only applied to services
that form the base unit of IaaS for interoperability so this trims the
tag to only include those projects. Higher level services which
consume these projects are removed from the list, as are projects
which are outside the scope of this tag.

Change-Id: I76ab6758aebd0f534b84b594952f858e95391138
'}]
commit_message:
Trim tc-approved-release tag to just base IaaS projects

This commit removes the tc-approved-release tag from non-base IaaS
projects. This tag is only used for marking which projects the TC
says can be included in defcore. When it was first created "the
integrated release" at the time was used to initially populate it.
However, just as with most things in the pre-big-tent world this
wasn't actually a good answer. The tag should only applied to services
that form the base unit of IaaS for interoperability so this trims the
tag to only include those projects. Higher level services which
consume these projects are removed from the list, as are projects
which are outside the scope of this tag.

Change-Id: I76ab6758aebd0f534b84b594952f858e95391138

subject: Remove times.dbm file for each tox run
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-07-20 19:43:09.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'tox.ini'], 'message': "Remove times.dbm file for each tox run

If you run the py27 tox tests then attempt to run the py34 tests,
the following error will occur:

    py34 runtests: commands[0] | ostestr
    --blacklist_file=blacklist-py3.txt
    db type could not be determined
    running=${PYTHON:-python} -m subunit.run discover
    ./trove/tests/unittests --list
    The test run didn't actually run any tests

This happens because the apparently the times.dbm file generated
by py27 is not compatible with py34. The converse is not true though -
if you run py34 first, py27 will work.

The work-around is to delete the file, which is what is now done
before running every tox test. Once the bug has been fixed, the
work-around can be removed.

This was originally noticed in python-troveclient, however it
also manifests in the Trove project.

coverage.xml was also added to the .gitignore file as it
was appearing in the git list of modified files.

Change-Id: I312b3879c764b7b803d35e0bb62f0f47291f6693
Closes-Bug: #1565928
"}]
commit_message:
Remove times.dbm file for each tox run

If you run the py27 tox tests then attempt to run the py34 tests,
the following error will occur:

    py34 runtests: commands[0] | ostestr
    --blacklist_file=blacklist-py3.txt
    db type could not be determined
    running=${PYTHON:-python} -m subunit.run discover
    ./trove/tests/unittests --list
    The test run didn't actually run any tests

This happens because the apparently the times.dbm file generated
by py27 is not compatible with py34. The converse is not true though -
if you run py34 first, py27 will work.

The work-around is to delete the file, which is what is now done
before running every tox test. Once the bug has been fixed, the
work-around can be removed.

This was originally noticed in python-troveclient, however it
also manifests in the Trove project.

coverage.xml was also added to the .gitignore file as it
was appearing in the git list of modified files.

Change-Id: I312b3879c764b7b803d35e0bb62f0f47291f6693
Closes-Bug: #1565928

subject: Add --ignore=wrongdistribution parameter to reprepro
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 12:00:18.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/packaging-mirror.yaml'], 'message': 'Add --ignore=wrongdistribution parameter to reprepro

sbuild is setup to use "jessie-newton", but the backports repository
is called "jessie-newton-backports". It'd be annoying to have special
cases for the install of sbuild. It is a lot easier to just add
--ignore=wrongdistribution when calling reprepro, which is what this
patch is doing.

Change-Id: I5619e8d2cd593e0a598127e5d8113ed293fee6aa
'}]
commit_message:
Add --ignore=wrongdistribution parameter to reprepro

sbuild is setup to use "jessie-newton", but the backports repository
is called "jessie-newton-backports". It'd be annoying to have special
cases for the install of sbuild. It is a lot easier to just add
--ignore=wrongdistribution when calling reprepro, which is what this
patch is doing.

Change-Id: I5619e8d2cd593e0a598127e5d8113ed293fee6aa

commit_message:
fix diff-start handling in release scripts

Always provide a non-empty value for diff-start, but use "-" to signal
that the announce script should use the last tag as the starting
point.

Pass the value from list_deliverable_changes.py to release.sh correctly.

Change-Id: If56bf1471659f8a27edbed840a880ac998e6759a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-08-09 19:52:01.000000000', 'files': ['reference/charter.rst'], 'message': "Don't be specific the number of seats per election

Instead of explicitly specifying when 7 members will be elected, this
patch adapts the wording so that it is clear that all the opened seats
would need to be filled on every election.

Change-Id: Idd0752d4f76cbad257dbc588bfd053a4fefd7fca
"}]
commit_message:
Don't be specific the number of seats per election

Instead of explicitly specifying when 7 members will be elected, this
patch adapts the wording so that it is clear that all the opened seats
would need to be filled on every election.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-06 21:33:12.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/resource_provider.py'], 'message': "Correct InventoryList model references

InventoryList._get_all_by_resource_provider was indicating models to
use in a query by db_api.models.[model] which meant that the models
that were being used were those designed for the main/cell database,
not the api database as intended. Since there are duplicates of many
of the resource provider related models between sqlalchemy/models.py
and sqlalchemy/api_models.py this wasn't making any difference in
testing: the context controls the database being used not the
models.

However, since at some point we might clear up the orphaned models
it is best to correct this now to avoid confusion later.

Change-Id: I0ff01ec1b7de0bfbd194846a1381ddc2e665b735
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools
"}]
commit_message:
Correct InventoryList model references

InventoryList._get_all_by_resource_provider was indicating models to
use in a query by db_api.models.[model] which meant that the models
that were being used were those designed for the main/cell database,
not the api database as intended. Since there are duplicates of many
of the resource provider related models between sqlalchemy/models.py
and sqlalchemy/api_models.py this wasn't making any difference in
testing: the context controls the database being used not the
models.

However, since at some point we might clear up the orphaned models
it is best to correct this now to avoid confusion later.

Change-Id: I0ff01ec1b7de0bfbd194846a1381ddc2e665b735
Partially-Implements: blueprint generic-resource-pools

subject: Only run one docs job on devstack
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-06 01:13:00.000000000', 'files': ['zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Only run one docs job on devstack

During the migration from trusty -> xenial the docs jobs a branch
filter was missed on the docs job for devstack. This resulted in
2 docs jobs running on every commit, one on trusty the other on
master. This commit fixes the oversight and just runs the xenial job
on master, but leaves the trusty job for stable branches.

Change-Id: Iae1e4972c870e0390225ceda901d676e62e7aaba
'}]
commit_message:
Only run one docs job on devstack

During the migration from trusty -> xenial the docs jobs a branch
filter was missed on the docs job for devstack. This resulted in
2 docs jobs running on every commit, one on trusty the other on
master. This commit fixes the oversight and just runs the xenial job
on master, but leaves the trusty job for stable branches.

Change-Id: Iae1e4972c870e0390225ceda901d676e62e7aaba

subject: change django_openstack_auth to not use canonical name
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-09 13:05:18.000000000', 'files': ['upper-constraints.txt'], 'message': "change django_openstack_auth to not use canonical name

The release job that tried to update this constraint failed because the
name in the setup.cfg package metadata did not match the name here in
the constraints list. We could change the name in the metadata, but that
would break a bunch of links to existing build artifacts. Since a lot of
other packages in this file do not use the canonical name, let's change
this entry to use the name from setup.cfg instead of the canonical form.

Change-Id: I2a584195063fed11b4ee51b783045331815a8576
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
change django_openstack_auth to not use canonical name

The release job that tried to update this constraint failed because the
name in the setup.cfg package metadata did not match the name here in
the constraints list. We could change the name in the metadata, but that
would break a bunch of links to existing build artifacts. Since a lot of
other packages in this file do not use the canonical name, let's change
this entry to use the name from setup.cfg instead of the canonical form.

Change-Id: I2a584195063fed11b4ee51b783045331815a8576
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 27, 'created': '2016-08-05 23:48:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/functional/wsgi/test_servers.py', 'nova/compute/cells_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/conductor/manager.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_cells.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'Cells: Handle delete with BuildRequest

When an instance delete is issued the instance could be in a few
different states which require different handling.

If the instance is in a cell and booted or booting then the delete can
proceed normally.

If there is a BuildRequest object for the instance then it is still
being built and has not reached a cell yet. In this situation there may
or may not also be an instance record depending on how much future work
has merged. The BuildRequest should be destroyed, any InstanceMapping
that exists should be cleaned up, and if there is an Instance it should
be deleted normally.

The added functional test does not check for a change in behavior. It
ensures that the behavior of delete does not change as the delete
process is updated. Note that the only delete path that bails early is
not yet reachable. The test keeps things honest as that changes.

Change-Id: I27d89143e8804aebdd414791f03b622abdaafe90
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction
'}]
commit_message:
Cells: Handle delete with BuildRequest

When an instance delete is issued the instance could be in a few
different states which require different handling.

If the instance is in a cell and booted or booting then the delete can
proceed normally.

If there is a BuildRequest object for the instance then it is still
being built and has not reached a cell yet. In this situation there may
or may not also be an instance record depending on how much future work
has merged. The BuildRequest should be destroyed, any InstanceMapping
that exists should be cleaned up, and if there is an Instance it should
be deleted normally.

The added functional test does not check for a change in behavior. It
ensures that the behavior of delete does not change as the delete
process is updated. Note that the only delete path that bails early is
not yet reachable. The test keeps things honest as that changes.

Change-Id: I27d89143e8804aebdd414791f03b622abdaafe90
Partially-implements: bp add-buildrequest-obj
Partially-implements: bp cells-scheduling-interaction

When we construct the environment Ironic functional gate job,
we got the following error:

The /opt/stack/new/ironic-python-agent project was not found;
if this is a gate job, add the project to the $PROJECTS variable
in the job definition.

This patch adds openstack/ironic-python-agent to $PROJECTS
to fix this problem.

Change-Id: I57b886d62c2b6917d2cb0e300d1319d47477e578
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Ironic functional job by properly setting PROJECTS

When we construct the environment Ironic functional gate job,
we got the following error:

The /opt/stack/new/ironic-python-agent project was not found;
if this is a gate job, add the project to the $PROJECTS variable
in the job definition.

This patch adds openstack/ironic-python-agent to $PROJECTS
to fix this problem.

Change-Id: I57b886d62c2b6917d2cb0e300d1319d47477e578

subject: [POC] Remove most I/O inventory tests
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-06-14 14:46:48.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': '[POC] Remove most I/O inventory tests

Previous work on the dynamic inventory wrote to and read from the
filesystem in order to change configurations between tests. This was
problematic for a couple reasons:

    1) It leads to increased runtime for the unit tests, which was
    largely unnecessary. This change reduced the test runtime by about
    50%

    2) Failed tests and test suite interruptions (like ctrl-c) sometimes
    left behind files, which dirtied the git working tree. By writing
    out configuration to the file system, the git working tree was
    constantly being altered then reset. This change means that the
    inventory tests only ever read.

Mocks are used throughout the tests now in order to fake the filesystem
access. Currently, there is a large number of mocks because of the
coupling within the target codebase.

Change-Id: I10cf2c2ed36f159499e71525f73139da5e14b8be
'}]
commit_message:
[POC] Remove most I/O inventory tests

Previous work on the dynamic inventory wrote to and read from the
filesystem in order to change configurations between tests. This was
problematic for a couple reasons:

    1) It leads to increased runtime for the unit tests, which was
    largely unnecessary. This change reduced the test runtime by about
    50%

    2) Failed tests and test suite interruptions (like ctrl-c) sometimes
    left behind files, which dirtied the git working tree. By writing
    out configuration to the file system, the git working tree was
    constantly being altered then reset. This change means that the
    inventory tests only ever read.

Mocks are used throughout the tests now in order to fake the filesystem
access. Currently, there is a large number of mocks because of the
coupling within the target codebase.

Change-Id: I10cf2c2ed36f159499e71525f73139da5e14b8be

revisions:
[{'number': 20, 'created': '2016-08-05 23:48:00.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/instance.py', 'nova/tests/unit/objects/test_instance.py'], 'message': "instance.name should be blank if instance.id is not set

By default the ability to generate instance.name depends on the
instance.id field. However the value for this field comes from the
autoincrement id column in the instance table. This means that if the
instance has not been written to a database, as will be the case before
scheduling in cellsv2, there is no way to properly determine what the
instance name will be.

In that situation the instance name will now be returned as '' if the
vm_state and task_state match the pre-scheduled instance case. If the
instance does not have the right vm_state/task_state set an error will
be logged and the instance uuid will be returned as the name. Using uuid
matches what happens for template failures.

Change-Id: I4a743c61a619af6f91a102a219fc0ec49df19d9d
"}]
commit_message:
instance.name should be blank if instance.id is not set

By default the ability to generate instance.name depends on the
instance.id field. However the value for this field comes from the
autoincrement id column in the instance table. This means that if the
instance has not been written to a database, as will be the case before
scheduling in cellsv2, there is no way to properly determine what the
instance name will be.

In that situation the instance name will now be returned as '' if the
vm_state and task_state match the pre-scheduled instance case. If the
instance does not have the right vm_state/task_state set an error will
be logged and the instance uuid will be returned as the name. Using uuid
matches what happens for template failures.

Change-Id: I4a743c61a619af6f91a102a219fc0ec49df19d9d

commit_message:
Add configure-devstack task for devstack gate

This patch adds 'configure-devstack' task to enable CORS headers in
keystone before functional-test are run.
No 'ini' library was used as I didn't find any supporting section
syntax "[[post-config|$KEYSTONE_CONF]]"

If using the config parameter backup_swift_auth_url for the
Swift backup driver in single_user mode, the project_id is
added to the auth_url. As the auth_url is expected to be a
keystone endpoint, this is not needed. This patch will fix

'}]
commit_message:
SwiftBackupDriver: Dont add project_id to authurl

If using the config parameter backup_swift_auth_url for the
Swift backup driver in single_user mode, the project_id is
added to the auth_url. As the auth_url is expected to be a
keystone endpoint, this is not needed. This patch will fix
this.

Change-Id: I865fb2f1dff188c2886ee0ea35a8f0f3c48724b8
Closes-Bug: #1518199

commit_message:
Splitting current/deprecated integ. test

Horizon now is interested in having two integration tests: 1) current
2) deprecated panels.

This patch changes the integration job into a job-template and configures
Horizon to use both the current/deprecated jobs.  The job-template
passes the 'type' parameter into the pre-test hook so it can differentiate
and configure the test environment appropriately.

Change-Id: I1f2028c18d6d9933a986a9bc47750e1b5fdca708
Partially-Implements: blueprint test-deprecated-features

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 2622, 'name': 'Samuel Merritt', 'email': 'sam@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'torgomatic'}, {'_account_id': 4608, 'name': 'Kota Tsuyuzaki', 'email': 'bloodeagle40234@gmail.com', 'username': 'tsuyuzaki-kota'}, {'_account_id': 7847, 'name': 'Alistair Coles', 'email': 'alistairncoles@gmail.com', 'username': 'acoles'}, {'_account_id': 12261, 'name': 'Mahati', 'email': 'mahati.chamarthy@gmail.com', 'username': 'Mahati'}, {'_account_id': 12279, 'name': 'Janie Richling', 'email': 'jrichli@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'jrichli'}, {'_account_id': 13052, 'name': 'SwiftStack Cluster CI', 'email': 'openstack-ci@swiftstack.com', 'username': 'swiftstack-cluster-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 15343, 'name': 'Tim Burke', 'email': 'tburke@nvidia.com', 'username': 'tburke'}, {'_account_id': 18602, 'name': 'Gábor Antal', 'email': 'antal@inf.u-szeged.hu', 'username': 'antal'}, {'_account_id': 21239, 'name': 'Alex Szarka', 'email': 'szarka@inf.u-szeged.hu', 'username': 'xavvior'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-07-25 02:07:22.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/crypto/encrypter.py', 'test/unit/common/middleware/crypto/test_encrypter.py'], 'message': "Raise ValueError if empty value coming into encrypt_header_val

encrypt_header_val is used to translate a raw header value into an
encrypted value. Semantically, a header with an empty value won't be stored
and all callers seem to remove such a header before calling
encrypted_header_val.

So if no reason for returning ('', None), I think it's better to change it to
raise ValueError not to cause another error for users of the return value.
(e.g. dump_crypto_meta)

Plus this patch addes a few unit tests for those cases above.

Change-Id: Ic1237f4afb8c0e466be5ce59fe31b667c39242b0
"}]
commit_message:
Raise ValueError if empty value coming into encrypt_header_val

encrypt_header_val is used to translate a raw header value into an
encrypted value. Semantically, a header with an empty value won't be stored
and all callers seem to remove such a header before calling
encrypted_header_val.

So if no reason for returning ('', None), I think it's better to change it to
raise ValueError not to cause another error for users of the return value.
(e.g. dump_crypto_meta)

Plus this patch addes a few unit tests for those cases above.

Change-Id: Ic1237f4afb8c0e466be5ce59fe31b667c39242b0

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-08-03 16:50:54.000000000', 'files': ['os_brick/tests/encryptors/test_base.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_iscsi.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxscsi.py', 'os_brick/tests/base.py', 'os_brick/tests/remotefs/test_remotefs.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_disco.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_aoe.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/connectors/test_scaleio.py', 'os_brick/tests/initiator/test_linuxfc.py'], 'message': "Fix the mocking mess

Our tests' mocking is a little messy, we have tests that start a mocking
but don't stop it, others try to stop it but use a mock object instead
of a patcher object, so they don't stop it, and we keep using stopall to
stop the patchings instead of individual stops, and we've seen in Cinder
that this can be problematic.

This patch fixes these issue, most of them just by using base TestCase
mock_object method, and some calling the right stop method (ie:
VolumeEncryptorTestCase).

Change-Id: I545abfa8749e778e923c37e0b908efc578f70619
"}]
commit_message:
Fix the mocking mess

Our tests' mocking is a little messy, we have tests that start a mocking
but don't stop it, others try to stop it but use a mock object instead
of a patcher object, so they don't stop it, and we keep using stopall to
stop the patchings instead of individual stops, and we've seen in Cinder
that this can be problematic.

This patch fixes these issue, most of them just by using base TestCase
mock_object method, and some calling the right stop method (ie:
VolumeEncryptorTestCase).

Change-Id: I545abfa8749e778e923c37e0b908efc578f70619

subject: Storwize:create_volume_from_snapshot with different size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-02 08:19:01.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/ibm/test_storwize_svc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/ibm/storwize_svc/storwize_svc_common.py'], 'message': "Storwize:create_volume_from_snapshot with different size

create_volume_from_snapshot, currently the Storwize driver
can't handle a volume size larger than the original snapshot.
This patch fixes this issue by extending the volume after
creating volume from the snapshot.

Change-Id: I895a2d152b464e3cc09c1c5fb8ec81539a263443
Closes-Bug: 1560658
"}]
commit_message:
Storwize:create_volume_from_snapshot with different size

create_volume_from_snapshot, currently the Storwize driver
can't handle a volume size larger than the original snapshot.
This patch fixes this issue by extending the volume after
creating volume from the snapshot.

Change-Id: I895a2d152b464e3cc09c1c5fb8ec81539a263443
Closes-Bug: 1560658

commit_message:
Add has_callbacks method to callbacks registry

This can be helpful in situations where someone wants to determine
whether or not other callbacks are listening to the same resource
event.

subject: Add exception message translations
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-09 14:02:22.000000000', 'files': ['smaug/services/protection/checkpoint.py', 'smaug/services/protection/manager.py', 'smaug/services/protection/provider.py', 'smaug/services/protection/graph.py', 'smaug/services/protection/flows/workflow.py', 'smaug/services/protection/resource_graph.py'], 'message': 'Add exception message translations

There were a few cases where strings sent to exceptions were not
being translated. According to the i18n guidelines, any strings
used for exceptions should use the _() marker.

This addresses the obvious cases where a string was being passed
in the exception constructor. There may be other cases where strings
are being assigned to a variable first before being passed in that
still need to be fixed.

Change-Id: I18e0a9bb9bc8ca06d6774ef992e500594df3d4b1
'}]
commit_message:
Add exception message translations

There were a few cases where strings sent to exceptions were not
being translated. According to the i18n guidelines, any strings
used for exceptions should use the _() marker.

This addresses the obvious cases where a string was being passed
in the exception constructor. There may be other cases where strings
are being assigned to a variable first before being passed in that
still need to be fixed.

Change-Id: I18e0a9bb9bc8ca06d6774ef992e500594df3d4b1

commit_message:
Revert "We don't need to set a default for the CephX keys and cluster FSID"

This reverts commit 9b1ceee031644c798c5c01d9689f15b4daf44aa7. In mitaka
we don't have roles so upgrade of those deployments not using Ceph will
fail validation unless we have a default set for these parameters.

Villalovos', 'email': 'openstack.org@sodarock.com', 'username': 'jlvillal'}, {'_account_id': 15751, 'name': 'Intel PCI CI', 'email': 'pci-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intelpcici', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16897, 'name': 'Virtuozzo Storage CI', 'email': 'vzstorage-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'vzstorage-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16898, 'name': 'Virtuozzo CI', 'email': 'virtuozzo6-ci@virtuozzo.com', 'username': 'virtuozzo6-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2015-09-03 17:43:13.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/ironic/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/ironic/test_driver.py'], 'message': 'Make ironic ephemeral bdm match default value

Commit 7f8128f87f5a2fa93c857295fb7e4163986eda25 caused Nova to start
explicitly creating a mapping for ephemeral block devices, which
caused the metadata for Ironic ephemeral partitions to be incorrect.
This is because Ironic does not use the Nova bdm to assign devices,
which is a problem in and of itself.  See related bug below.

This change at least fixes the regression so that in the basic case
of a standard SATA ephemeral partition the device path returned by
the metadata server will match what was assigned in Ironic.  It
does not address environments where the ephemeral partition is on
another path such as /dev/vda1, but those do not appear to have
ever worked.

Change-Id: Ida25db52799a83d3d353fd61d178945201e9b8dc
Closes-Bug: 1464239
Related-Bug: 1478065
'}]
commit_message:
Make ironic ephemeral bdm match default value

Commit 7f8128f87f5a2fa93c857295fb7e4163986eda25 caused Nova to start
explicitly creating a mapping for ephemeral block devices, which
caused the metadata for Ironic ephemeral partitions to be incorrect.
This is because Ironic does not use the Nova bdm to assign devices,
which is a problem in and of itself.  See related bug below.

This change at least fixes the regression so that in the basic case
of a standard SATA ephemeral partition the device path returned by
the metadata server will match what was assigned in Ironic.  It
does not address environments where the ephemeral partition is on
another path such as /dev/vda1, but those do not appear to have
ever worked.

Change-Id: Ida25db52799a83d3d353fd61d178945201e9b8dc
Closes-Bug: 1464239
Related-Bug: 1478065

commit_message:
Only db-sync sahara is included in the bootstrapnode

Currently, sahara's db-sync is run on every node. We should instead
run it if we're on the bootstrap node as race conditions may occur
and these will cause issues.

Change-Id: I5db281caae17402ff198cb4cd46304338d98c52e

commit_message:
Make notification objects use flavor capacity attributes

This makes the notification objects to  use instance.flavor.$resource
instead of instance.$resource.

The FlavorPayload schema has been changed but the version is not bumped
as this change does not affect the notification structure or content.

Change-Id: Ie1de19d0eb67e12e96e62b339c67f8ab8eb8999d

commit_message:
NetApp cDOT vserver deletion fails if no lifs present

If no LIFs are present on a vserver (such as can happen if an error
occurs during share creation in driver_handles_share_servers=True
mode), the vserver deletion fails due to a recent change. This makes
the deletion path more resilient.

Change-Id: I475b7b00cd5ba6bb111e2002bb8faa49e4878592
Closes-Bug: #1607029

subject: Fix Python 3 issues in diskfile
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-07-26 13:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['test/unit/obj/test_auditor.py', 'swift/obj/diskfile.py'], 'message': 'Fix Python 3 issues in diskfile

* Fix bytes vs Unicode issues
* On Python 3, encode JSON to UTF-8 and decode it from UTF-8
* Open files in binary mode to avoid Unicode issues
* test_auditor: use bytes for content, open files in binary mode

Change-Id: Ifa84001493cfb57975d3b140b0d7e09020504bca
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Python 3 issues in diskfile

* Fix bytes vs Unicode issues
* On Python 3, encode JSON to UTF-8 and decode it from UTF-8
* Open files in binary mode to avoid Unicode issues
* test_auditor: use bytes for content, open files in binary mode

Change-Id: Ifa84001493cfb57975d3b140b0d7e09020504bca

commit_message:
Fix busted release notes

A bad release note slipped through because the bash script
wasn't returing the actual results. This fixes the script
and the busted release note.

Change-Id: Id32557f34121fe82fac21d089e4117a72ff585e5
Closes-Bug: #1610312
